sentence_text: INTRODUCTION The Company has identified the on-shore section of the Gascoyne Platform in the South Carnarvon Basin as the most prospective part of the Carnarvon Basin for potash mineralisation.
event_text: several suitable target areas were identified with the areas applied for as exploration licences. this report details the work completed on one of these target areas, e9 1443, during its first year. introduction the company has identified the on shore section of the gascoyne platform in the south carnarvon basin as the most prospective part of the carnarvon basin for potash mineralisation. the gascoyne platform is a diamond shaped area that covers about 86,000km 2 and contains up to 5,000m of sediments.

sentence_text: GEOLOGY The Gascoyne project area contains a sequence of Ordovician to Permian sediments that overlie Precambrian basement rocks.
event_text: location and access the project area is located approximately 100 km east north east of carnarvon in the gascoyne mineral field. access is the main gascoyne junction road commencing from 25km south of carnarvon. geology the gascoyne project area contains a sequence of ordovician to permian sediments that overlie precambrian basement rocks. the main target is the yaringa member of the 750mthick, dirk hartog formation of silurian age.

sentence_text: A recent detailed analysis of drilling, seismic, gravity and other geological data has resulted in the identification of several areas that are prospective for potash mineralisation.
event_text: bromine levels in the halite are high (up to 330ppm), suggesting precipitation from highly concentrated halite and bittern field brines. traces of sylvite (kcl) were reported in the yaringa no 1 well. a recent detailed analysis of drilling, seismic, gravity and other geological data has resulted in the identification of several areas that are prospective for potash mineralisation. the selection criteria for the targets include local thickening of the target dirk hartog formation (figure 2) at basin edges and locations in the distal parts of the basin where high order evaporite brines were generated and salts precipitated.

sentence_text: EXPLORATION COMPLETED Following examination of the gravity and previous drillhole data, an 1176 metre diamond drill hole was completed.

sentence_text: There is apparently no reason why black shale that forms an extensive planar surface should become conductive over a strike length of 200m or so, but remain non-conductive elsewhere.
event_text: the apparent limited strike length of the anomaly itself is not sufficient to constitute a discrete target: an electrically thick conductor composed of several sub parallel layers will give rise to a power law response, even if it is strike limited. the limited strike length of the observed mltem response has puzzled some geoscientists involved in the project, given the fairly unremarkable lithologies intersected by llrc0002 and lldd0001. there is apparently no reason why black shale that forms an extensive planar surface should become conductive over a strike length of 200m or so, but remain non conductive elsewhere. nevertheless, this is a common phenomenon that has frustrated explorers for as long as electromagnetic techniques have been used to target drill holes.

sentence_text: Iron Ore mineralisation in the Hamersley Province is divided into Bedded (BID), Channel (CID) and Detrital (DID) Iron Deposits.
event_text: these folds and their associated thrusts accommodate n s shortening across the province. d4 and d5 produced upright, open folds that combine with the d3 folds to form local dome and basin fold patterns. iron ore mineralisation in the hamersley province is divided into bedded (bid), channel (cid) and detrital (did) iron deposits. bedded iron deposits are predominantly developed within the mt newman member and nammuldi member of the marra mamba formation and the dales gorge member of the brockman iron formation.

sentence_text: The resulting mineralisation then undergoes burial metamorphism to form microplaty haematite.
event_text: there are two main models for the genesis of these deposits. one model suggests supergene alteration of the bif to develop goethitemartite ores. the resulting mineralisation then undergoes burial metamorphism to form microplaty haematite. the other model puts forward hypogene alteration of martite enriched bif by replacement of the gangue with goethite and or deposition of microplaty haematite.

sentence_text: The other model puts forward hypogene alteration of martite enriched BIF by replacement of the gangue with goethite and/or deposition of microplaty haematite.

sentence_text: The Dales Gorge Member is host to the majority of iron ore mineralisation, with Tom Price, Paraburdoo, Whaleback, and Rhodes Ridge being typical examples.
event_text: of these members, the mount newman member is host to the major deposits presently being mined and consists of a thick succession of bif, shale, and carbonate rocks. the brockman iron formation consists of bif, shale and chert and is divided into the dales gorge, mt whaleback, joffre, and yandicoogina shale members. the dales gorge member is host to the majority of iron ore mineralisation, with tom price, paraburdoo, whaleback, and rhodes ridge being typical examples. during the tertiary, a series of erosion deposition hardpanisation (ferricrete) cycles resulted in the regionally extensive hamersley surfaces that can contain economic detrital iron mineralisation.

sentence_text: During the Tertiary, a series of erosion-deposition-hardpanisation (ferricrete) cycles resulted in the regionally extensive Hamersley surfaces that can contain economic Detrital Iron Mineralisation.
event_text: the brockman iron formation consists of bif, shale and chert and is divided into the dales gorge, mt whaleback, joffre, and yandicoogina shale members. the dales gorge member is host to the majority of iron ore mineralisation, with tom price, paraburdoo, whaleback, and rhodes ridge being typical examples. during the tertiary, a series of erosion deposition hardpanisation (ferricrete) cycles resulted in the regionally extensive hamersley surfaces that can contain economic detrital iron mineralisation. these surfaces have subsequently been eroded by the existing drainage system, often preserving remnants of the hamersley surfaces in mesas.

sentence_text: On the western side of the shear zone, the bedrock sequence comprises basalts, komatiites, sediments and minor felsic volcanics.
event_text: flanking the belt are major archaean intrusive granitic bodies. the major structural feature of the property area is the north northwest trending avoca shear zone that dips to the west. on the western side of the shear zone, the bedrock sequence comprises basalts, komatiites, sediments and minor felsic volcanics. to the east of the avoca shear, the sequence is dominated by basalt, dolerite and sediments and in the easternmost portions of the kurnalpi property by felsic volcanic rocks.

sentence_text: Bedrock gold mineralisation is associated with the major Avoca Shear Zone and with the northeast trending faults.
event_text: late stage northeast trending faults cross cut the avoca shear zone and east to east southeast trending thrust faults are interpreted as being present in the north to the south of an intrusive granite. tertiary and quaternary deposits of various origins cover the bedrock sequence and dominate much of the area where outcrops are generally sparse. bedrock gold mineralisation is associated with the major avoca shear zone and with the northeast trending faults. gold derived from the bedrock structures has entered the alluvial sequences and was a major source of the gold produced during the active mining period at kurnalpi.

sentence_text: Nickel mineralisation is present mainly in the west of the Kurnalpi property where it is present both in the laterite weathering profile overlying ultramafic sequences and also in the bedrock.
event_text: gold derived from the bedrock structures has entered the alluvial sequences and was a major source of the gold produced during the active mining period at kurnalpi. the gold was noted as being coarse grained and nuggety in distribution. nickel mineralisation is present mainly in the west of the kurnalpi property where it is present both in the laterite weathering profile overlying ultramafic sequences and also in the bedrock. outcrop is poor over the project area due to deep weathering profiles and thin soils covering the over 95% of the bedrock.

sentence_text: Regolith types that were encountered were reported to have varied from sandy quartz-rich transported soils, lateritic duricrust and minor areas of residual saprock.

sentence_text: The dominant structural trend over the western tenements is NNW/SSE with a minor ENE/WSW, evident from the aeromagnetic images, the latter confirmed by quartz vein orientations.
event_text: within the southern areas of the current tenements, etheridge henley williams recognized two (2) granite types, an early syn extensional phase termed external and a later post extensional intrusive phase termed internal. the greenstone occurrences in the southern areas east of the faulted igneous contact with the domal external granite are interpreted as an amphibolite sequence of mafic origin, probably part of the duketon greenstone belt. the dominant structural trend over the western tenements is nnw sse with a minor ene wsw, evident from the aeromagnetic images, the latter confirmed by quartz vein orientations. the major nnw structure is believed to be late due to its cross cutting relationship with the granites.

sentence_text: HQ2-sized core, being largely Mesozoic-aged barren overburden, was not trayed and left at the drill site.
event_text: geologically, the overburden consisted mainly of poorly consolidated medium grained sandstones with a base of matrix supported pebble to cobble sized, polymictic conglomerate. the nature of this overburden, together with high water tables caused significant delays in hole collaring, conditioning and penetration. hq2 sized core, being largely mesozoic aged barren overburden, was not trayed and left at the drill site. nq2 sized core was trayed, orientated, metre marked, geologically logged and selectively assayed, generally at metre intervals as determined by the site geologist.

sentence_text: Anomalies were field inspected and a strong correlation was found between the presence of surface pisolites, subtle changes in elevation and elevated radiometric counts.
event_text: a review of the aeromagnetic radiometric survey completed in june 2005 highlighted a number of palaeochannel shaped surface radiometric anomalies. these anomalies were up to 1250m long and up to 250m wide with peak values greater than 100 counts per second. anomalies were field inspected and a strong correlation was found between the presence of surface pisolites, subtle changes in elevation and elevated radiometric counts. no surface calcrete was observed.

sentence_text: Previous historical drilling at both the Highway and Supply Well prospects has identified an unusual style of disseminated and semi-massive nickel-copper sulphide mineralization that appears stratabound and discordant within meta-sediments, cherts and possible ultramafic rocks.

sentence_text: The De Grey Group overlies the Gorge Creek Group and is comprised of medium to coarse grained metasediments with minor quantities of volcanic and volcanoclastic rocks.

sentence_text: Where there are extensive deposits of recent alluvium, it is difficult to determine whether Tertiary alluvium also occurs in the valleys, and a distinction between the two alluvial units Qa and Cza is uncertain.
event_text: white to yellow sand (gs) occurs widely along drainage divides. it is the remnant of a former continuous sandplain, now extensively reworked so that the sand veneer is much thinner on the top of hills than on the flanks, where it accumulates as colluvial deposits. where there are extensive deposits of recent alluvium, it is difficult to determine whether tertiary alluvium also occurs in the valleys, and a distinction between the two alluvial units qa and cza is uncertain. tertiary alluvium (cza) is identified as a flat surface on valley floors, on which present day river meanders, braided drainage, and lake systems are developed.

sentence_text: Recent alluvial sediments (Qa) are distinguished in the upper portions of drainage valleys and in more steeply sloping minor valleys.
event_text: tertiary alluvium (cza) is identified as a flat surface on valley floors, on which present day river meanders, braided drainage, and lake systems are developed. there is a sharp change in slope at the foot of the adjacent hills. recent alluvial sediments (qa) are distinguished in the upper portions of drainage valleys and in more steeply sloping minor valleys. in major valleys they overlie tertiary alluvium, and are there included with this alluvium as cza.

sentence_text: This links the mining centres of Hayes New Find, Gindalbie and Lindsays Find and other major mining centres to the south.
event_text: swager, c.p., 1995, geology of the greenstone terranes in the kurnalpi edjudina region, southeastern yilgarn craton: western australia geological survey, report 47, 31p. according to geological reports of the regional geology, the regional magnetic feature is a major nnw trending fault (hampton fault) or shear zone extending over a strike length of 50kms. this links the mining centres of hayes new find, gindalbie and lindsays find and other major mining centres to the south. the project area is overlain by a generally shallow regolith and lindsays find mine is located within a steep south plunging antiform containing secondary isoclinal folds.

sentence_text: The project area is overlain by a generally shallow regolith and Lindsays Find mine is located within a steep south plunging antiform containing secondary isoclinal folds.
event_text: according to geological reports of the regional geology, the regional magnetic feature is a major nnw trending fault (hampton fault) or shear zone extending over a strike length of 50kms. this links the mining centres of hayes new find, gindalbie and lindsays find and other major mining centres to the south. the project area is overlain by a generally shallow regolith and lindsays find mine is located within a steep south plunging antiform containing secondary isoclinal folds. the mine sequence comprises magnesium enriched porphyritic basalt in contact with epiclastic sedimentary rocks (shales to fine sandstones) and an andesite porphyry stock intruding this sequence along a nne trending corridor, hosting the bulk of the gold mineralisation.

sentence_text: The mine sequence comprises magnesium enriched porphyritic basalt in contact with epiclastic sedimentary rocks (shales to fine sandstones) and an andesite porphyry stock intruding this sequence along a NNE trending corridor, hosting the bulk of the gold mineralisation.

sentence_text: Introduction The Lindsays Find Project is situated 56kms north northeast of the city of Kalgoorlie-Boulder in the Eastern Goldfields of Western Australia (see Figure 1).
event_text: the status of geological mapping and general structural knowledge of the area is incomplete however an improved understanding of lithological and structural controls of gold mineralisation has made exploration drilling and resource definition a success. carrick gold limited; kalgoorlie office figure 2 tenement boundaries 1. introduction the lindsays find project is situated 56kms north northeast of the city of kalgoorlie boulder in the eastern goldfields of western australia (see figure 1). the project tenure comprises two mining leases, eighteen prospecting licenses and two exploration licences over a total area of approximately 150 sq km.

sentence_text: A northwest track six hundred metres north from the turnoff to Carosue Dam leads to the Lindsays Find area located 4.5kms from the main road.
event_text: the project tenure comprises two mining leases, eighteen prospecting licenses and two exploration licences over a total area of approximately 150 sq km. the main route to the project passes through the township of kanowna on a sealed road, and then heads toward the mining centre of gindalbie bypassing roads to the mining centres of kurnalpi, black swan and carosue dam. a northwest track six hundred metres north from the turnoff to carosue dam leads to the lindsays find area located 4.5kms from the main road. generally the topography is subdued and characterised by low rounded hills of mafic outcrop which grade into wide alluvial valleys.

sentence_text: Generally the topography is subdued and characterised by low rounded hills of mafic outcrop which grade into wide alluvial valleys.
event_text: the main route to the project passes through the township of kanowna on a sealed road, and then heads toward the mining centre of gindalbie bypassing roads to the mining centres of kurnalpi, black swan and carosue dam. a northwest track six hundred metres north from the turnoff to carosue dam leads to the lindsays find area located 4.5kms from the main road. generally the topography is subdued and characterised by low rounded hills of mafic outcrop which grade into wide alluvial valleys. gold was first discovered in the region at kanowna in 1893 and soon after at gindalbie and lindsays find.

sentence_text: Gold was first discovered in the region at Kanowna in 1893 and soon after at Gindalbie and Lindsays Find.
event_text: a northwest track six hundred metres north from the turnoff to carosue dam leads to the lindsays find area located 4.5kms from the main road. generally the topography is subdued and characterised by low rounded hills of mafic outcrop which grade into wide alluvial valleys. gold was first discovered in the region at kanowna in 1893 and soon after at gindalbie and lindsays find. it was not long before shallow mining commenced and substantial quantities of gold were being produced.

sentence_text: Lindsay's Find was reported to have produced 4,237t at 19g/t.
event_text: it was not long before shallow mining commenced and substantial quantities of gold were being produced. during that early period of mining, kanowna yielded approximately 1.0m oz and gindalbie around 40,000oz at grades of the order of 1.0oz ton. lindsay's find was reported to have produced 4,237t at 19g t. the ground was picked over by small scale operators during the 1930s with only 100 oz (950t at 3.0g t) extracted.

sentence_text: Rainfall in the area varies from light falls during winter to heavier, patchy falls in summer and autumn.
event_text: throughout the carrick vale prospecting and exploration licences there is evidence of small scale surface mining, involving trenching and shallow shafts, most of which is unrecorded and of uncertain timing. the climate is semi arid with an annual rainfall of about 250mm and annual evaporation of about 2300mm. rainfall in the area varies from light falls during winter to heavier, patchy falls in summer and autumn. in some instances this region can become flooded due to very heavy rains brought about by tropical cyclones which move in from the northwest (ahmat, 1995) the area has moderate dense vegetation and so access to other parts of the property can be achieved by travelling cross country using a four wheel drive vehicle (refer: figure 1).

sentence_text: Westerly dipping shear zones that host gold mineralisation are known in the vicinity of the antiform axis and there are also northeast trending structures.
event_text: the main structure in the tenement area is a nnw trending antiform that runs through the trial pit and extends to the north and south. the antiform plunges to the sse so that there is a southern closure on the surface trace of rock units. westerly dipping shear zones that host gold mineralisation are known in the vicinity of the antiform axis and there are also northeast trending structures. these two structural orientations are associated with the fold mineralisation.

sentence_text: These two structural orientations are associated with the fold mineralisation.
event_text: the antiform plunges to the sse so that there is a southern closure on the surface trace of rock units. westerly dipping shear zones that host gold mineralisation are known in the vicinity of the antiform axis and there are also northeast trending structures. these two structural orientations are associated with the fold mineralisation. a post folded porphyritic biotite granite intrusion is located in the central portion of the lindsays find project which may have been the mechanism for the development of structural sites for the deposition of significant gold mineralization.

sentence_text: A post folded porphyritic biotite-granite intrusion is located in the central portion of the Lindsays Find project which may have been the mechanism for the development of structural sites for the deposition of significant gold mineralization.
event_text: westerly dipping shear zones that host gold mineralisation are known in the vicinity of the antiform axis and there are also northeast trending structures. these two structural orientations are associated with the fold mineralisation. a post folded porphyritic biotite granite intrusion is located in the central portion of the lindsays find project which may have been the mechanism for the development of structural sites for the deposition of significant gold mineralization. gold mineralisation probably developed initially in north northwest trending shear zones during strikeslip deformation parallel to fold planar foliations.

sentence_text: Gold mineralisation probably developed initially in north-northwest trending shear zones during strikeslip deformation parallel to fold planar foliations.
event_text: these two structural orientations are associated with the fold mineralisation. a post folded porphyritic biotite granite intrusion is located in the central portion of the lindsays find project which may have been the mechanism for the development of structural sites for the deposition of significant gold mineralization. gold mineralisation probably developed initially in north northwest trending shear zones during strikeslip deformation parallel to fold planar foliations. the probable presence of ultramafic rocks low in the stratigraphic sequence, below the lindsays find project, suggests the most likely reservoirs for ore fluids.

sentence_text: The probable presence of ultramafic rocks low in the stratigraphic sequence, below the Lindsays Find project, suggests the most likely reservoirs for ore fluids.
event_text: a post folded porphyritic biotite granite intrusion is located in the central portion of the lindsays find project which may have been the mechanism for the development of structural sites for the deposition of significant gold mineralization. gold mineralisation probably developed initially in north northwest trending shear zones during strikeslip deformation parallel to fold planar foliations. the probable presence of ultramafic rocks low in the stratigraphic sequence, below the lindsays find project, suggests the most likely reservoirs for ore fluids. it should be noted that as well as gold fluids, highgrade nickel sulphide ore is mined at silver swan located in an adjoining tenement south west of the project.

sentence_text: Access to the tenure from Kalgoorlie is via the Yarri Road for approximately 65kms through Kanowna townsite, passing roads to Black Swan Nickel Mine, Carosue Dam and Lindsays Find towards Edjudina and Gindalbie Homestead (Refer: Figure 1).
event_text: carrick gold limited; kalgoorlie office figure 2 tenement boundaries p27 1645 figure 3 auger soil location plan 1. introduction, location and vegetation the prospecting licence p27 1645 is located approximately 70kms north east of kalgoorlie boulder and is centred at 6646312 north, 381259 east (gda 94) and has an area of 45ha. access to the tenure from kalgoorlie is via the yarri road for approximately 65kms through kanowna townsite, passing roads to black swan nickel mine, carosue dam and lindsays find towards edjudina and gindalbie homestead (refer: figure 1). the climate is semi arid with an annual rainfall of about 250mm and annual evaporation of about 2300mm.

sentence_text: Rainfall in the area varies from light falls during winter to heavier, patchy falls in summer and autumn.
event_text: access to the tenure from kalgoorlie is via the yarri road for approximately 65kms through kanowna townsite, passing roads to black swan nickel mine, carosue dam and lindsays find towards edjudina and gindalbie homestead (refer: figure 1). the climate is semi arid with an annual rainfall of about 250mm and annual evaporation of about 2300mm. rainfall in the area varies from light falls during winter to heavier, patchy falls in summer and autumn. in some instances this region can become flooded due to very heavy rains brought about by tropical cyclones which move in from the northwest (ahmat, 1995) the area has moderate dense vegetation and so access to other parts of the property can be achieved by travelling cross country using a four wheel drive vehicle.

sentence_text: The terrane contains greenstone successions separated by regional lowangle faults.
event_text: in some instances this region can become flooded due to very heavy rains brought about by tropical cyclones which move in from the northwest (ahmat, 1995) the area has moderate dense vegetation and so access to other parts of the property can be achieved by travelling cross country using a four wheel drive vehicle. geological setting the tenement p27 1645 ( refer: figure 2) is in the gindalbie terrane to the east of the kalgoorlie terrane and is bounded by the mount monger fault in the west, the emu fault and penny dam conglomerate in the east. the terrane contains greenstone successions separated by regional lowangle faults. the tenement geology is restricted to felsic volcanic rocks occurring within the gindalbie terrane outcropping in the south western corner including tuff mainly dacitic but ranging from rhyolitic to andesitic in composition.

sentence_text: 3.2 Auger Drilling A soil sampling programme was undertaken using a tractor supporting an auger drill.
event_text: work programme 3.1 research & review of previous exploration data reading of open file reports continued in order to obtain information on the area and prepare a geological base plan for future exploration. the information from reports indicated the prospectivity of the tenement. 3.2 auger drilling a soil sampling programme was undertaken using a tractor supporting an auger drill. soils were taken from a depth varying between 0.1 metres and 1 metre depending on the location of a strong carbonate layer in the soil.

sentence_text: The project is focussed on extensive mafic intrusives located on the southern margin of the Pilbara craton on the intersection of a number of continental scale magnetic and gravity features.
event_text: the project is focussed on extensive mafic intrusives located on the southern margin of the pilbara craton on the intersection of a number of continental scale magnetic and gravity features. in the bulloo downs area, a voluminous, unnamed mafic complex intruded a platformal carbonate sequence of the bangemall basin during the late mesoproterozoic prior to deformation of the bangemall group.

sentence_text: Work in the 2007/2008 reporting period will include a reassessment of the project and a decision as to the potential for the as yet unexplained magnetic/gravity anomaly located in the northern portion of the project to host economic mineralisation.
event_text: much of the area is covered by a thin veneer of colluvium which could mask the source of this geophysical anomaly. figure 2 shows the extent of the currently mapping mafic intrusives within the project area. work in the 2007 2008 reporting period will include a reassessment of the project and a decision as to the potential for the as yet unexplained magnetic gravity anomaly located in the northern portion of the project to host economic mineralisation. exploration activity during 2006 2007 included completion of a review of historical exploration, a 3353 line km magnetic survey and field checking (including 27 grab samples) of geophysical anomalies and geochemical anomalies identified from the historical work.

sentence_text: A full logistical report on the magnetic survey can be found in appendix 1 and all data in appendix 2.

sentence_text: The Bulloo Downs area, like the Musgrave Province, falls on the southern margin of the Central Australian Mega-Element (AGSO, 1996) and is effectively along strike from the Late Mesoproterozoic, Giles Mafic-Ultramafic Complex, which hosts the Nebo and Babel Ni/Cu sulphide deposits.
event_text: the bulloo downs area encompasses a crustal scale transfer zone where thrusting to the south and east is accommodated by a series of conjugate strike slip faults. intersecting linear gravity features can be identified in the bulloo downs area, which may represent mantle tapping by these strike slip faults. the bulloo downs area, like the musgrave province, falls on the southern margin of the central australian mega element (agso, 1996) and is effectively along strike from the late mesoproterozoic, giles mafic ultramafic complex, which hosts the nebo and babel ni cu sulphide deposits. the maximum age of the bulloo downs mafic complex from intrusive relationships, suggests that it may be coeval with intrusion of the giles complex.

sentence_text: This work was not followed up.

sentence_text: Overlying these complexes are extensive mafic and ultramafic volcanic rocks and intrusive equivalents.
event_text: a series of calc alkaline felsic (andesite with lesser dacite and rhyolite) volcanic complexes (welcome well, edjudina) occur throughout the domain. they are the lowermost part of the regional stratigraphy in the welcome wellminerie district, although they overlie tholeiitic basaltic rocks in the yarriwallbrook district. overlying these complexes are extensive mafic and ultramafic volcanic rocks and intrusive equivalents. in the uppermost parts of the succession particularly in the murrin murrin and eucalyptus districts are komatiitic basalt and lesser low mg komatiite and extensive ultramafic cumulate units.

sentence_text: Felsic volcanism is best preserved in the Welcome Well complex, which is dominated by felsic volcaniclastic rocks with subordinate felsic (andesite) and mafic (tholeiite) volcanic rocks and intruded by regionally extensive dolerite and gabbro sills (Giles & Hallberg, 1982; Hallberg, 1985).
event_text: accordingly to groenewald et al. (2006), the lowermost part of the succession is the welcome well formation that consists of volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks that are predominantly andesitic in composition. felsic volcanism is best preserved in the welcome well complex, which is dominated by felsic volcaniclastic rocks with subordinate felsic (andesite) and mafic (tholeiite) volcanic rocks and intruded by regionally extensive dolerite and gabbro sills (giles & hallberg, 1982; hallberg, 1985). the welcome well formation is overlain by the minerie formation that consists of tholeiitic to komatiitic basalts, with extensive dolerite and gabbro and interlayered with epiclastic sedimentary units.

sentence_text: The Welcome Well Formation is overlain by the Minerie Formation that consists of tholeiitic to komatiitic basalts, with extensive dolerite and gabbro and interlayered with epiclastic sedimentary units.
event_text: 2006), the lowermost part of the succession is the welcome well formation that consists of volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks that are predominantly andesitic in composition. felsic volcanism is best preserved in the welcome well complex, which is dominated by felsic volcaniclastic rocks with subordinate felsic (andesite) and mafic (tholeiite) volcanic rocks and intruded by regionally extensive dolerite and gabbro sills (giles & hallberg, 1982; hallberg, 1985). the welcome well formation is overlain by the minerie formation that consists of tholeiitic to komatiitic basalts, with extensive dolerite and gabbro and interlayered with epiclastic sedimentary units. the basaltdominated succession is characterized by lateral and vertical transitions between massive coherent facies, pillow lava and autoclastic facies (doyle et al., 2004).

sentence_text: In the south of the domain, are several fault-bounded successions of basalt with minor komatiite and dolerite and gabbro sills overlain by felsic volcaniclastic and metasedimentaryfelsic epiclastic units, and are truncated against the Kilkenny fault system.
event_text: the uppermost murrin murrin formation consists of komatiitic basalts associated with layered mafic ultramafic cumulates and felsic volcaniclastic rocks, principally in the kilkenny syncline and adjacent areas and in the western limb of the eucalyptus anticline. the ultramafic cumulates are interpreted to be komatiitic in origin and their regolith is host to the murrin murrin lateritic ni co deposit (hill et al., 2001). in the south of the domain, are several fault bounded successions of basalt with minor komatiite and dolerite and gabbro sills overlain by felsic volcaniclastic and metasedimentaryfelsic epiclastic units, and are truncated against the kilkenny fault system. small scale trust duplexes and possible larger scale bedding parallel faults imply repetition and or juxtaposition of various supracrustal packages (swager, 1995).

sentence_text: Small-scale trust duplexes and possible larger scale bedding-parallel faults imply repetition and/or juxtaposition of various supracrustal packages (Swager, 1995).
event_text: the ultramafic cumulates are interpreted to be komatiitic in origin and their regolith is host to the murrin murrin lateritic ni co deposit (hill et al., 2001). in the south of the domain, are several fault bounded successions of basalt with minor komatiite and dolerite and gabbro sills overlain by felsic volcaniclastic and metasedimentaryfelsic epiclastic units, and are truncated against the kilkenny fault system. small scale trust duplexes and possible larger scale bedding parallel faults imply repetition and or juxtaposition of various supracrustal packages (swager, 1995). in the darlotspring well district in the northern part of the murrin domain, the greenstone succession consists of a basal basaltic package with rhyolite volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks and minor interflow metasedimentary units, overlain by felsic volcanic rocks of the spring well complex and more voluminous metasedimentary rocks considered to be distal equivalents of the spring well complex.

sentence_text: In the DarlotSpring Well district in the northern part of the Murrin Domain, the greenstone succession consists of a basal basaltic package with rhyolite volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks and minor interflow metasedimentary units, overlain by felsic volcanic rocks of the Spring Well complex and more voluminous metasedimentary rocks considered to be distal equivalents of the Spring Well complex.

sentence_text: Further to the north the sequence comprises mainly mafic and komatiitic mafic to ultramafic volcanic rocks, with some intermediate tuffs and minor intercalated black shales and later intruded by quartz feldspar porphyry and granitoid.
event_text: bedrock can be interpreted from isolated exposures of outcrop throughout the project area. to the south of the apollo project area a small monzogranitic pluton is intrudes into the bulyardie anticline, this pluton is hosted by a sequence of granodiorite porphyry, felsic volcanic and felsic volcano sedimentary deposits. further to the north the sequence comprises mainly mafic and komatiitic mafic to ultramafic volcanic rocks, with some intermediate tuffs and minor intercalated black shales and later intruded by quartz feldspar porphyry and granitoid. principle lithologies exposed within the mt kildare area consist of a thick sequence of mafic and lesser ultramafic metavolcanic rocks with associated doleritic intrusive and sill units, and volumetrically lesser argillaceous arenaceous metasedimentary lithologies of distal felsic derivation.

sentence_text: Limited previous exploration has been completed in the project area, with the extensive cover restricting the effectiveness of prospecting and surface sampling.
event_text: the mt vetters project is in the kalgoorlie region of the norseman wiluna greenstone belt in a district with a history of gold and nickel production, with the cawse nickel laterite mine located to the south west of the project area. the project covers the southern portion of the cawse monzogranite and is covered by varying depths of alluvium. limited previous exploration has been completed in the project area, with the extensive cover restricting the effectiveness of prospecting and surface sampling. the broad spaced drilling that has been completed in the project area was successful in identifying anomalous gold associated with granite under cover.

sentence_text: Field inspection, GIS data compilation and interpretation and correlation with similar local and regional mineralisation styles and occurrences was completed.
event_text: limited previous exploration has been completed in the project area, with the extensive cover restricting the effectiveness of prospecting and surface sampling. the broad spaced drilling that has been completed in the project area was successful in identifying anomalous gold associated with granite under cover. field inspection, gis data compilation and interpretation and correlation with similar local and regional mineralisation styles and occurrences was completed. this review suggests there is potential for the mt vetters project area to host gold in granite style mineralisation similar to that known in the area of the broad arrow project, however the extensive cover masks any potential surface geochemical response.

sentence_text: The extensive opaque component means that information from transmitted light microscopy (thin section) would be limited (including any recognition of asbestos minerals, which would be largely camouflaged by the opaque oxide).
event_text: figure 8 below is an example of the detail of the accretionary textures seen in botryoidal goethite. initial macroscopic assessment indicated that approximately half of these samples are dominated by goethite limonite, some plus apparent hematite, with perhaps another half composed of ferruginised cherty silica. the extensive opaque component means that information from transmitted light microscopy (thin section) would be limited (including any recognition of asbestos minerals, which would be largely camouflaged by the opaque oxide). analytical procedures to provide the required information was therefore considered to be by polished section mineragraphic assessment of minerals (as far as possible with such goethitic limonitic material), also study of textures with an attempt to offer comment on genesis, together with photomicrographs.

sentence_text: Gold mineralisation in the Mosquito Creek Belt exhibits strong structural and lithological controls, from the regional scale through to the outcrop scale.
event_text: gold mineralisation in the mosquito creek belt exhibits strong structural and lithological controls, from the regional scale through to the outcrop scale. although structural timing relationships and wall rock alteration paragenesis imply that mineralisation occurred late in the tectonic history of the belt, during d4, it is clear that the reactivation of earlier generations of structures also played an important role in controlling ore fluid flow and the localisation of gold mineralisation.

sentence_text: Although structural timing relationships and wall-rock alteration paragenesis imply that mineralisation occurred late in the tectonic history of the belt, during D4, it is clear that the reactivation of earlier generations of structures also played an important role in controlling ore-fluid flow and the localisation of gold mineralisation.
event_text: gold mineralisation in the mosquito creek belt exhibits strong structural and lithological controls, from the regional scale through to the outcrop scale. although structural timing relationships and wall rock alteration paragenesis imply that mineralisation occurred late in the tectonic history of the belt, during d4, it is clear that the reactivation of earlier generations of structures also played an important role in controlling ore fluid flow and the localisation of gold mineralisation. at the regional scale, the gold deposits along the middle creek line lie close to the northern margin of the d4 kurrana shear zone, and, in the western part at least, are spatially associated with the series of mafic ultramafic lenses that mark the trace of the d1 middle creek fault (figure 4).

sentence_text: 11 The exception to this style of mineralisation is the Golden Eagle deposit, in which there is no clear association between gold and quartz.
event_text: the unifying characteristic of the mineralised quartz veins, and that which distinguishes them from the large number of barren d2 quartz veins further north, is the extent of modification by superimposed d4 deformation. richly mineralised veins are i) strongly recrystallised, ii) commonly cut by late stage, quartz and carbonate filled fractures, and iii) are surrounded by zones of d4 chloritisation, carbonation and faulting, that link ultimately to the margin of the kurrana shear zone. 11 the exception to this style of mineralisation is the golden eagle deposit, in which there is no clear association between gold and quartz. however, there is a strong association between gold and late stage, chlorite and pyrite rich, quartz filled fractures, which are attributed to deformation and fluid flux during d4.

sentence_text: The main mechanism for gold deposition appears to have been declining temperature as the fluid moved away from the shear zone because, in detail, the richest gold mineralisation is generally not located directly in contact with the margin of the Kurrana Shear Zone.
event_text: the d1 middle creek fault, which is marked by the series of mafic ultramafic rock lenses, probably played a role in regional fluid flux also, albeit in an indirect manner, by controlling the development of the d4 shear zone. reactivation of d2 faults and vein margins in the vicinity of the boundary of the kurrana shear zone was likely to have been promoted by high fluid pressure within the shear zone, and fluid flux into the secondary d2 structures was probably enhanced by their relatively higher permeability (due to a component of brittle behaviour). the main mechanism for gold deposition appears to have been declining temperature as the fluid moved away from the shear zone because, in detail, the richest gold mineralisation is generally not located directly in contact with the margin of the kurrana shear zone. an alternative mechanism involving gold deposition due to decreasing or fluctuating fluid pressure at the shear zone boundary appears less likely given the distal position of the richest mineralisation.

sentence_text: An alternative mechanism involving gold deposition due to decreasing or fluctuating fluid pressure at the shear zone boundary appears less likely given the distal position of the richest mineralisation.
event_text: reactivation of d2 faults and vein margins in the vicinity of the boundary of the kurrana shear zone was likely to have been promoted by high fluid pressure within the shear zone, and fluid flux into the secondary d2 structures was probably enhanced by their relatively higher permeability (due to a component of brittle behaviour). the main mechanism for gold deposition appears to have been declining temperature as the fluid moved away from the shear zone because, in detail, the richest gold mineralisation is generally not located directly in contact with the margin of the kurrana shear zone. an alternative mechanism involving gold deposition due to decreasing or fluctuating fluid pressure at the shear zone boundary appears less likely given the distal position of the richest mineralisation. the gold deposits along the blue spec line do not show an obvious association with a major ductile structure as is the case with the middle creek line and the kurrana shear zone.

sentence_text: Most of the gold deposits on the Blue Spec Line occur in quartz veins or minor faults adjacent to the obvious fault zones, in a manner akin to the deposits along the Middle Creek Line.
event_text: this belt scale d1 fault, and second order d1 and d2 faults linking with it, are characterised by strong shearing, chloritisation and carbonation over tens of metres due to reactivation during d4. another feature of the faults along the blue spec line is the widespread occurrence of fibrous, quartz carbonate veining, which points to crack seal behaviour in response to extreme fluid pressures within these structures. most of the gold deposits on the blue spec line occur in quartz veins or minor faults adjacent to the obvious fault zones, in a manner akin to the deposits along the middle creek line. again, the larger faults probably represent the primary fluid conduits, and fluid fluxing into subsidiary structures was responsible for gold deposition along the blue spec line.

sentence_text: This model is in keeping with the generally higher crustal level features of the Blue Spec Line, such as the limited width of the primary conduits and the association of antinomy with gold mineralisation.
event_text: declining fluid temperature was unlikely to be the main mechanism for gold deposition because of the narrow width of the faults carrying the ore fluids. given the evidence for crack seal behaviour, a model involving gold deposition in response to pressure fluctuations at the brittle ductile transition may be more appropriate. this model is in keeping with the generally higher crustal level features of the blue spec line, such as the limited width of the primary conduits and the association of antinomy with gold mineralisation. at depth, the blue spec line may be underlain by a broader zone of d4 shearing centred on the d1 blue spec fault.

sentence_text: The roughly east-west trending Mosquito Creek Belt extends for about 65 km along strike, and 25 km across strike.
event_text: all soil sampling assays are found in appendix 1 and plate 1 is a sample location plan for each sample site. the nullagine gold project encompasses a large part of the archaean mosquito creek belt, which is situated near the south eastern margin of the pilbara craton of western australia (figure 2). the roughly east west trending mosquito creek belt extends for about 65 km along strike, and 25 km across strike. submarine, siliciclastic sedimentary rocks of turbiditic origin are the main components of the belt, and these rocks are separated by thin (<200 m thick) units of mafic and ultramafic volcanic rocks.

sentence_text: This mapping also supports an interpretation that the Mosquito Creek Formation can be subdivided into two parts; the upper part characterised by interlayered shale, siltstone and thinly bedded, fine to mediumgrained sandstone, and the lower part containing a greater abundance of 1 to 10 mthick coarse-grained sandstone and conglomerate beds (interlayered with shale, siltstone and fine to medium-grained sandstone).
event_text: mapping by company geologists in 2005 show that the mafic ultramafic rocks in most cases appear to be juxtaposed against sedimentary rock units by faults. it is proposed here that there may be only one sedimentary formation within the mosquito creek belt, and that the thin units of mafic ultramafic rocks may represent fault imbricated slices of a volcanic basin floor upon which the sedimentary rock were deposited (probably as a prograding submarine fan system). this mapping also supports an interpretation that the mosquito creek formation can be subdivided into two parts; the upper part characterised by interlayered shale, siltstone and thinly bedded, fine to mediumgrained sandstone, and the lower part containing a greater abundance of 1 to 10 mthick coarse grained sandstone and conglomerate beds (interlayered with shale, siltstone and fine to medium grained sandstone). routine geological structural mapping and traversing was conducted throughout the nullagine project between 2004 and 2008.

sentence_text: The Archaean rocks are dominated by mafic and ultramafic volcanics although minor interflow sediments are present.
event_text: cazaly resources limited 2008 annual report e25 0337 bare hill project cazaly resources limited july 2008 2 contents page 1.0 summary 3 2.0 introduction 4 3.0 tenure 4 4.0 geology 6 the bare hill project is located on the eastern flank of the bulong anticline, within the gindalbie terrane of the archaean norseman wiluna greenstone belt in the eastern goldfields province of the yilgarn craton. the archaean rocks are dominated by mafic and ultramafic volcanics although minor interflow sediments are present. the mafic rocks include fine, medium and coarse grained varieties, which loosely translate to basalt, dolerite and gabbro (smith, 1997).

sentence_text: High-Mg basalts, dolerites, quartz dolerites and minor quartzfeldspar porphyries contained within the Boorara-Menzies Shear Zone host gold mineralization at the Corsair and Boorara Mining Centres.
event_text: 5555 kilometresil trkilo etresil tril trkilo etresil trkilo etresil tr 2008 annual report e25 0337 bare hill project cazaly resources limited july 2008 6 4.0 geology gold mineralization within the region is associated with several different host lithologies and mineral assemblages. high mg basalts, dolerites, quartz dolerites and minor quartzfeldspar porphyries contained within the boorara menzies shear zone host gold mineralization at the corsair and boorara mining centres. at corsair, the regional chloritecarbonate alteration has been overprinted by a silica sericite pyrite assemblage along with chalcopyrite and gold mineralization.

sentence_text: 3.1 Introduction and Background The Tjukayirla project is one of the few remaining unexplored regions of WA which still holds potential for a tier 1 high MgO NiS discovery with over 80km of prospective strike.
event_text: an aeromagnetic survey was flown as a targeting tool for testing the inferred mafic ultramafic stratigraphy below the palaeozoic sediments. due to the limited detail available within the existing widely spaced gswa bmr dataset, a high resolution airborne magnetic survey was undertaken to increase the capabilities of interpretation and give confidence in depth modelling. 3.1 introduction and background the tjukayirla project is one of the few remaining unexplored regions of wa which still holds potential for a tier 1 high mgo nis discovery with over 80km of prospective strike. existing magnetic coverage over the tjukayirla package was collected in 1976 at 3000m altitude; this survey identified a strong north south magnetic feature with approximately 80km of strike flanked by weaker magnetic anomalies in what appears to be a classic bif, mafic, ultramafic stratigraphy.

sentence_text: On the western side of the shear zone, the bedrock sequence comprises basalts, komatiites, sediments and minor felsic volcanics.
event_text: site inspection of areas with limited exploration was conducted concurrently making note of landmarks such as fence lines, gates and tracks and identifiable vegetation and mineral rocky outcrops. the major structural feature of the property area is the north northwest trending avoca shear zone that dips to the west. on the western side of the shear zone, the bedrock sequence comprises basalts, komatiites, sediments and minor felsic volcanics. to the east of the avoca shear, the sequence is dominated by basalt, dolerite and sediments and in the easternmost portions of the kurnalpi property by felsic volcanic rocks.

sentence_text: The historic Hogans Find Gold Mine, which is immediately to the northeast of the Project area, has a recorded production of 314.5 tonnes of ore, at an average grade of 27.35g/t gold up to 1904, together with 909 ounces of alluvial gold.

sentence_text: Regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and high-Mg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons.
event_text: to the north, the domain limits terminate south of the carnilya anticline at the east trending talcum fault, a major thrust that separates the parker domain from its northern neighbour, the boorara domain. one hundred and twenty kilometres to the south southeast granitoids of the norseman terrane close out the parker domains southward continuation. regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and high mg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons. the outcropping greenstones of the parker domain appear to relate regionally with the upper basalt unit and felsic volcanic sedimentary unit of the adjacent kambalda domain.

sentence_text: However in the east, the sedimentary rocks contain magnetite-rich BIF horizons which may be more closely associated with the adjacent BIFbearing sedimentary rocks of the Kurnalpi Terrane.
event_text: regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and high mg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons. the outcropping greenstones of the parker domain appear to relate regionally with the upper basalt unit and felsic volcanic sedimentary unit of the adjacent kambalda domain. however in the east, the sedimentary rocks contain magnetite rich bif horizons which may be more closely associated with the adjacent bifbearing sedimentary rocks of the kurnalpi terrane. any comparisons drawn are tenuous as much of the parker domain, to date, has been only lightly explored and cursorily mapped.

sentence_text: 6.0 AZTEC DOME PROSPECT 6.1 GROUND IP SURVEY Following a review of the 2008 induced polarisation (IP) and electromagnetic (EM) surveys it was concluded that IP was the most appropriate method for nickel and/or gold mineralisation in the Aztec Dome.
event_text: since that time the coogee gold deposit has been on the market, and as part of the on 5 cgc1482001a2009 coogee project 2009 annual report going marketing process, an information memorandum has been produced and updated. the most recent version, incorporating all 2009 mining studies, is shown in appendix 5. 6.0 aztec dome prospect 6.1 ground ip survey following a review of the 2008 induced polarisation (ip) and electromagnetic (em) surveys it was concluded that ip was the most appropriate method for nickel and or gold mineralisation in the aztec dome. a three man geophysical crew from zonge engineering and research organisation (australia) pty ltd (zonge), south australia, completed ip surveying on the cleared historic bhp grid lines 12000nw 19000nw (excluding 13000nw surveyed in 2008), covering a portion of the southern aztec dome, between 27 08 2009 12 09 2009.

sentence_text: Data quality and repeatability were monitored throughout the course of the survey which ensured that the best possible data were acquired given local conditions and time constraints.
event_text: data collection along 7 grid lines amounted to 1,282 points over 17 line kilometres. survey planning and geophysical consulting were performed by bill robertson of value adding resources pty ltd to whom the data was sent for interpretation and modeling. data quality and repeatability were monitored throughout the course of the survey which ensured that the best possible data were acquired given local conditions and time constraints. the ip survey was designed to locate small volumes of massive sulphide mineralisation surrounded by appreciable volumes of disseminated sulphide mineralisation of the kambalda style of nickel deposit, as well as any type of disseminated and or massive sulphide mineralisation, be it gold or base metals, hosted by mafics and ultramafics of the aztec dome, or sediments and volcanics in adjoining sequences.

sentence_text: The IP survey was designed to locate small volumes of massive sulphide mineralisation surrounded by appreciable volumes of disseminated sulphide mineralisation of the Kambalda style of nickel deposit, as well as any type of disseminated and/or massive sulphide mineralisation, be it gold or base metals, hosted by mafics and ultramafics of the Aztec Dome, or sediments and volcanics in adjoining sequences.

sentence_text: Holes AZRC004 and AZRC006 (drilled in to IP anomaly D), targeting a geophysical anomaly on the western edge of the Aztec Dome, skimmed the edge of the high density isosurface and, not surprisingly, failed to intersect any ultramafics.
event_text: some magnesian basalt was logged in hole azrc007, 128 166m downhole, which is approximately at the correct depth for the high density isosurface, and a similar magnesian basalt was logged high up in hole azrc008, 10 83m downhole, well above the high density isosurface. the lithologies intersected in the three ip anomaly c rc holes cannot be equated with the high density isosurface, suggesting that the isosurface is wrongly interpreted in this locality, or; does not equate to the presence of ultramafics in this locality, or; may reflect a higher density source at greater depth than the current drilling. holes azrc004 and azrc006 (drilled in to ip anomaly d), targeting a geophysical anomaly on the western edge of the aztec dome, skimmed the edge of the high density isosurface and, not surprisingly, failed to intersect any ultramafics. further reinterpretation of ip, gravity, and magnetic data is required to better explain any lithological and geophysical correlations.

sentence_text: The drill rig sampling system was cleaned between holes and when necessary during drilling to maintain the sample quality.

sentence_text: Gold mineralisation is widely distributed throughout the area, in a variety of rock types.
event_text: the project consists of one mining lease, covering a total area of approximately 3km. the tenement is wholly owned by terrain minerals ltd, with a royalty payable to kambalda mining nl of $10.00 per ounce of gold, up to the first 10,000 ounces produced from the tenements and thereafter $5.00 per ounce of gold. gold mineralisation is widely distributed throughout the area, in a variety of rock types. the largest known deposit is the coogee prospect, with a resource of 230,000t @ 3.27g t gold (24,000 oz), which is associated with a skarnoid calc silicate alteration assemblage in sediments and volcanics.

sentence_text: The top of the deposit is <25m below the surface and the primary mineralisation has been affected by supergene enrichment.
event_text: gold mineralisation is widely distributed throughout the area, in a variety of rock types. the largest known deposit is the coogee prospect, with a resource of 230,000t @ 3.27g t gold (24,000 oz), which is associated with a skarnoid calc silicate alteration assemblage in sediments and volcanics. the top of the deposit is <25m below the surface and the primary mineralisation has been affected by supergene enrichment. a pit optimisation study and open pit plan completed on may 2009 outline a mineable inventory of 101,000tonnes @ 3.86g t gold (~12,500 oz) generating an undiscounted cash flow of $5.86m over a twelve month mine life.

sentence_text: Regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and highMg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons.
event_text: to the north, the domain limits terminate south of the carnilya anticline at the east trending talcum fault, a major thrust that separates the parker domain from its northern neighbour, the boorara domain. one hundred and twenty kilometers to the southsoutheast granitoids of the norseman terrane close out the parker domains southward continuation. regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and highmg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons. the outcropping greenstones of the parker domain appear to relate regionally with the upper basalt unit and felsic volcanic sedimentary unit of the adjacent kambalda domain.

sentence_text: However, in the east, the sedimentary rocks contain magnetite-rich BIF horizons which may be more closely associated with the adjacent BIFbearing sedimentary rocks of the Kurnalpi Terrane.
event_text: regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and highmg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons. the outcropping greenstones of the parker domain appear to relate regionally with the upper basalt unit and felsic volcanic sedimentary unit of the adjacent kambalda domain. however, in the east, the sedimentary rocks contain magnetite rich bif horizons which may be more closely associated with the adjacent bifbearing sedimentary rocks of the kurnalpi terrane. any comparisons drawn are tenuous as much of the parker domain, to date, has been only lightly explored and cursorily mapped.

sentence_text: The Napier Range consists of a narrow and elongate complex of Devonian reef carbonates that are prospective for hosting lead, zinc and silver mineralisation.
event_text: 5 1.0 summary the narlarla lead zinc project is centred on the napier range, immediately south of the barker river, approximately 1,860 km north east of perth in the west kimberley region of western australia. the project area covers a portion of the north west corner of the lennard river 1:250,000 map sheet (se 51 8). the napier range consists of a narrow and elongate complex of devonian reef carbonates that are prospective for hosting lead, zinc and silver mineralisation. the carbonates are surrounded by zones of basin fill sediments, and unconformably overlie proterozoic metamorphic rocks.

event_text: 7 8 narlarla resource report in detail the devonian stratigraphy in the mid napier range consists of a basal conglomerate unit (van emmerick conglomerate) forming the van emmerick range to the north west of narlarla. thinner variants of this unit may be persistent throughout the area. the frasnian platform facies pillara limestone is locally extensive, although not in the immediate narlarla area, where the frasnian lower napier and famennian upper napier formation are the dominant limestone units. both are fore reef and slope facies carbonates containing locally abundant terriginous material in a variably bedded and dolomitised impure limestone.

sentence_text: The belt contains several large historical and current gold mines near Bullfinch, Southern Cross and Marvel Loch as well as abundant small gold showings.
event_text: the licence lies within the southern cross greenstone belt, a tract of slightly to strongly metamorphosed archaean rocks that were initially widespread mafic and ultramafic volcanics, sedimentary rocks, and more restricted felsic volcanics. the belt extends discontinuously for approximately 400 km, from north of southern cross south to ravensthorpe near the southern coast of western australia. the belt contains several large historical and current gold mines near bullfinch, southern cross and marvel loch as well as abundant small gold showings. the southern half of the belt is host to the recent nickel discoveries, flying fox and spotted quoll in the forrestania area.

sentence_text: Regional metamorphic grade increases southwards through the district, from the lowest of grades in the Marda Complex, to quite high grade in the vicinity of Marvel Loch, and falls to low grade at Ravensthorpe.
event_text: the adjacent units in the greenstone belt display structures that are compatible with this; stratigraphic contacts and foliations dip moderately to steeply away from the margins of the neighbouring dome, and the stratigraphic units concordantly wrap the domes. post tectonic (non foliated) granitoids, discordant pegmatites and east west striking mafic dykes have intruded the above mentioned rocks. regional metamorphic grade increases southwards through the district, from the lowest of grades in the marda complex, to quite high grade in the vicinity of marvel loch, and falls to low grade at ravensthorpe. there is also a tendency for metamorphic grade to increase outwards towards the margins of the belt.

sentence_text: It is possible this is a basal sedimentation unit deposited on a stable basement; however this relationship has never been established.
event_text: 2 a consistent regional lithological layering, which is believed to have stratigraphic significance, is evident from the distribution of rock types around the granite domes. in a few localities, at the lowermost stratigraphic level is a thin interval of quartz muscovite schist and quartzite which occurs in sheared contact with the gneissic granitoid on the western side of the ghooli dome. it is possible this is a basal sedimentation unit deposited on a stable basement; however this relationship has never been established. this unit is overlain in a structural sense by a thick mafic unit.

sentence_text: Gold mineralisation in the region usually occurs with sulphide bearing quartz, localised by both structural and stratigraphic controls (Bagas, 1994).
event_text: this iron rich layer is interpreted to be a volcanogenic transitional unit between the mafic and sedimentary sequence, with exhalative features. the continuity of this same thick upper metasedimentary sequence well to the south into the forrestania area is clearly established. gold mineralisation in the region usually occurs with sulphide bearing quartz, localised by both structural and stratigraphic controls (bagas, 1994). host lithologies include mafic, ultramafic, bif and sediment hosts.

sentence_text: The potential presence of kimberlite in the Escape Creek tenement area is based on the occurrence of numerous diamond indicator minerals and diamonds in relatively small catchments, as recorded by previous explorers in the region.
event_text: the western australian kimberley region is part of the north australian craton such ancient stable crustal blocks are globally recognised as ideal settings for the occurrence of kimberlitic rocks. the kimberley region has been the focus of diamond exploration by a number of companies since the late 1960s, resulting in the discovery of the ellendale and argyle pipes (both active diamond mines, exploiting lamproite, a diamond host rock similar to kimberlite) in craton margin settings, and a significanat number of kimberlites and other lamproites with varying diamond content. the potential presence of kimberlite in the escape creek tenement area is based on the occurrence of numerous diamond indicator minerals and diamonds in relatively small catchments, as recorded by previous explorers in the region. the original area held is shown on figure 1.

sentence_text: The data were not considered sufficiently encouraging for ground follow up of some of the subtle magnetic anomalies.
event_text: the first systematic exploration for diamonds in the kimberley region was in 1967 when a consortium of three small exploration companies were granted a temporary reserve on the northern margin of the lennard shelf area in the southwest kimberley. apart from sampling some of the outcropping lamproites, like mount north, a combined aeromagnetic and radiometric survey of 1,777 line km was flown in 1968. the data were not considered sufficiently encouraging for ground follow up of some of the subtle magnetic anomalies. in 1969, gravel samples taken in the lennard river near police camp pool produced 9 small diamonds totalling 1.65 carats.

sentence_text: Many kimberlite or lamproite bodies were discovered during this period, though few showed promise for economic development, consistent with global trends that suggest only 1 in 200 or so kimberlites (or lamproites) are likely to have commercial potential.
event_text: in certain areas, aeromagnetic surveys were employed in particular a regional aeromagnetic survey over some 3,500 square km of the lennard shelf was carried out by the ashton joint venture which revealed numerous weak magnetic dipoles most of which are due to lamproite pipes many of which are large in surface area constituting what became known as the ellendale lamproite field. bodies ellendale 4 and ellendale 9 were of particular importance, and are currently being mined. many kimberlite or lamproite bodies were discovered during this period, though few showed promise for economic development, consistent with global trends that suggest only 1 in 200 or so kimberlites (or lamproites) are likely to have commercial potential. part of the escape creek tenement area is covered by a native title claim by the wanjina wunggurr willinggin tribal group.

sentence_text: Work undertaken in the reporting period involved drilling campaigns in six tenements targeting extensions of known gold deposits or previously untested geochemical anomalies, limited down hole surveying of some of the drill holes and some rehabilitation.
event_text: the btz bardoc project comprises of 10 mining licences and 1 prospecting license between the old bardoc and broad arrow gold mine sites. the tenure was acquired by halcyon after purchasing the bardoc south project from placer dome asia pacific limited (pdap) in 2004. work undertaken in the reporting period involved drilling campaigns in six tenements targeting extensions of known gold deposits or previously untested geochemical anomalies, limited down hole surveying of some of the drill holes and some rehabilitation. reviews by nickel consultant sarah dowling on drilling conducted on nickel targets within the tenure adjacent to p24 2495 highlighted several untested nickel targets.

sentence_text: Further exploration including drilling is required at many of the targets tested.
event_text: work undertaken in the reporting period involved drilling campaigns in six tenements targeting extensions of known gold deposits or previously untested geochemical anomalies, limited down hole surveying of some of the drill holes and some rehabilitation. reviews by nickel consultant sarah dowling on drilling conducted on nickel targets within the tenure adjacent to p24 2495 highlighted several untested nickel targets. further exploration including drilling is required at many of the targets tested.

sentence_text: The project is situated on the northern margin of the Bangemall Supergroup in a geological setting that is considered prospective for unconformity style uranium mineralisation and for stratabound and fault related base metals deposits.
event_text: encounter resources ltd pingandy creek project is located in the shire of upper gascoyne, some 84kms south of paraburdoo in western australia and approximately 900km north of perth (figure 1). the project is situated on the northern margin of the bangemall supergroup in a geological setting that is considered prospective for unconformity style uranium mineralisation and for stratabound and fault related base metals deposits. the pingandy creek project was targeted utilising the geochemical mapping and sampling completed by the geological survey of western australia (gswa) and uranium channel radiometrics (figure 2).

sentence_text: It is interbedded with fine to very coarse-grained sandstone, oolitic dolostone and minor chert.
event_text: the backdoor formation is approximately 1500m thick and is intruded by dolerite sills. it consists mostly of siltstone and mudstone that varies in colour from greenmaroon and cream. it is interbedded with fine to very coarse grained sandstone, oolitic dolostone and minor chert. the depositional environment for the siltstones is interpreted to be deposited below the storm wave base and records a progradation from distal shelf to proximal shelf environment.

sentence_text: Lenticular bodies of thick medium-coarse grained sandstone with interbedded siltstone and minor dolostone exist within this formation.
event_text: there is also a distal delta front depositional environment (martin et al, 2006). the blue billy formation is generally less than 200m thick and comprises a distinctive parallel planar laminated, black, carbonaceous siltstone that weathers to a blue grey colour. lenticular bodies of thick medium coarse grained sandstone with interbedded siltstone and minor dolostone exist within this formation. this formation resulted from an upward shallowing distal shelf succession (report).

sentence_text: It consists of interbedded dololutite, dolomitic siltstone, and siltstone with minor finemedium dolomitic sandstone and quartz sandstone.
event_text: this formation resulted from an upward shallowing distal shelf succession (report). the cheyne springs formation ranges from 50 300m thick but rarely exceeds 200m. it consists of interbedded dololutite, dolomitic siltstone, and siltstone with minor finemedium dolomitic sandstone and quartz sandstone. this formation marks a slight shallowing of the edmund basin and represents shelf and pelagic dolostones (report).

sentence_text: The Geological Survey of Australia corefarm was visited to view the historical HD1 diamond drill hole completed by Pasminco in 1994.
event_text: marine transgression was the depositional environment ranging from fluvial to shallow marine (report). during the reporting period encounter applied for combined report status on the 17th september 2008. the geological survey of australia corefarm was visited to view the historical hd1 diamond drill hole completed by pasminco in 1994. resampling was completed and samples sent away for assaying of uranium and vanadium.

sentence_text: Conversion of the historical drill data into the Encounter Resources Legend was commenced.

sentence_text: Further historical drilling in the most recently granted tenements was also reviewed.
