sentence_text: One diamond hole HD1 was drilled into the Hughes magnetic anomaly to a depth of 616.5m and a downhole gyroscopic and magnetic survey was done.
event_text: the area of the nwn claim is covered by an indigenous land use agreement (ilua) between the claimants and the state of western australia, dated 5 july 2001. final surrender report 2008 2009 4 in 1995 pasminco reviewed the 1994 airborne magnetics and radiometrics, completed soil geochemistry, regolith mapping and ground geophysics. one diamond hole hd1 was drilled into the hughes magnetic anomaly to a depth of 616.5m and a downhole gyroscopic and magnetic survey was done. a highly magnetic unit was intersected between 470 510m which was determined to be partially responsible for the hughes magnetic anomaly.

sentence_text: No significant mineralisation was intersected.
event_text: one diamond hole hd1 was drilled into the hughes magnetic anomaly to a depth of 616.5m and a downhole gyroscopic and magnetic survey was done. a highly magnetic unit was intersected between 470 510m which was determined to be partially responsible for the hughes magnetic anomaly. no significant mineralisation was intersected. a metre above the base of the black shales of the jillawarra formation is a 0.8m wide black pyritic calcarenite layer with 1410ppm zn.

sentence_text: It comprises thin-thick bedded dolostone, dolomitic siltstone, siltstone, dolostone breccia, dolomitic sandstone, stromatalitic dolostone and minor chert.
event_text: deposition is interpreted as mostly below storm wave base (report). the devil creek formation is generally 85 200m thick but can range up to 450m thick in places. it comprises thin thick bedded dolostone, dolomitic siltstone, siltstone, dolostone breccia, dolomitic sandstone, stromatalitic dolostone and minor chert. north of talga fault the depositional environment was platform carbonate environment and south was basinal mudstones (report).

sentence_text: It was found that the hyperspectral mapping delineated a zone of potential alteration of a known black pyritic shale horizon which is known to contain base-metal mineralisation.
event_text: the data was interpreted by brian bennett of australian geological and remote sensing services (agarss). his report was included in the 2007 2008 combined annual report (c051 2008) and has not been reported here as the majority of the report still remains confidential to encounter resources ltd. it was found that the hyperspectral mapping delineated a zone of potential alteration of a known black pyritic shale horizon which is known to contain base metal mineralisation. the hyperspectral data may also be used in the future to better define geology and structure of the area and highlight the best areas for geochemical sampling.

sentence_text: There is minor interbedded siltstone.
event_text: the calyie formation consists of sandstone and is 190m thick. the sandstone is mostly medium to very thick bedded and consists of medium to coarse grained quartz sandstone. there is minor interbedded siltstone. this formation is interpreted as being deposited in a shallow marine to fluvial depositional environment (martin et al, 2006).

sentence_text: Occasional steep ridges are found in the region where the lower members of the Edmund Group outcrop.
event_text: access to the tenement from the south is via the pingandy road from mt augustus or from the north via the ashburton meekatharra road from paraburdoo. the region is typified by a series of low lying, undulating hills interrupted by a network of broad, seasonal rivers. occasional steep ridges are found in the region where the lower members of the edmund group outcrop. minor flat lying mounts of calcrete can be seen within the broader drainage systems in the southwest of the project.

sentence_text: Minor flat lying mounts of calcrete can be seen within the broader drainage systems in the southwest of the project.
event_text: the region is typified by a series of low lying, undulating hills interrupted by a network of broad, seasonal rivers. occasional steep ridges are found in the region where the lower members of the edmund group outcrop. minor flat lying mounts of calcrete can be seen within the broader drainage systems in the southwest of the project. flora in the region is limited to low scrubs and grasses with larger bushes and trees restricted to the bound of the major drainages.

sentence_text: Collier The Collier group has an estimated thickness of about 2000-2500m and the main lithologies include predominantly siltstone, fine-very coarse-grained sandstone, pebbly sandstone, dolostone and minor chert and conglomerate.
event_text: it consists of thick to very thick bedded fine to very coarse grained quartz sandstone and pebbly sandstone, interbedded with siltstone. the depositional environment of this formation is thought to be turbidite fan deposits (report). collier the collier group has an estimated thickness of about 2000 2500m and the main lithologies include predominantly siltstone, fine very coarse grained sandstone, pebbly sandstone, dolostone and minor chert and conglomerate. thick dolerite sills intrude these units.

sentence_text: The Kiangi Creek Formation ranges from about 200-550m in thickness and consists of interbedded siltstone, sandstone with minor conglomerate and local dolostone.
event_text: the collier group is subdivided into the backdoor, calyie and ilgarari formations (martin and thorne, 2002). austramin holdings., 1990; mt boggola prospect, ashburton province, wa, the kiangi creek formation ranges from about 200 550m in thickness and consists of interbedded siltstone, sandstone with minor conglomerate and local dolostone. the formation is interpreted as a deep water depositional environment with some deposition occurring above storm wave base (report).

sentence_text: It consists of thin-bedded siltstone and mudstone with lesser fine-medium grained sandstone and minor chert and dolostone.
event_text: the formation is interpreted as a deep water depositional environment with some deposition occurring above storm wave base (report). the ullawarra formation varies in thickness from 100m north of the talga fault to 650m south of the fault. it consists of thin bedded siltstone and mudstone with lesser fine medium grained sandstone and minor chert and dolostone. the depositional environment for this unit is interpreted to be a deep marine shelf environment (report).

sentence_text: The Irregully Formation consists of laminated and stromatalitic dolostone and dolorudite, minor sandstone and dolomitic sandstone.
event_text: it consists of thin bedded siltstone and mudstone with lesser fine medium grained sandstone and minor chert and dolostone. the depositional environment for this unit is interpreted to be a deep marine shelf environment (report). the irregully formation consists of laminated and stromatalitic dolostone and dolorudite, minor sandstone and dolomitic sandstone. some rare conglomerate also exists.

sentence_text: Three locations of geochemical anomalism were identified but not followed up.
event_text: in 1965 anaconda was granted three temporary reserves to the west of pingandy creek. they completed a helicopter borne regional mapping and sampling program during which 6435 stream sediment samples and rock chip samples were collected and analysed for cu, pb and zn. three locations of geochemical anomalism were identified but not followed up. cra exploration targeted shale hosted pb an cu within either the clastic ashburton formation in the ashburton basin or in the irregully formation of the bangemall basin.

sentence_text: They completed drainage and rock geochemistry, geological interpretation and SIROTEM was used to follow up the INPUT anomalies noted.
event_text: cra exploration targeted shale hosted pb an cu within either the clastic ashburton formation in the ashburton basin or in the irregully formation of the bangemall basin. cra exploration obtained colour aerial photographs (1:25,000), airborne magnetics and radiometric and input surveys. they completed drainage and rock geochemistry, geological interpretation and sirotem was used to follow up the input anomalies noted. the sirotem surveys indicated a number of extremely conductive sediments existed near the base of the bangemall succession which was interpreted as black shales from the jillawarra formation.

sentence_text: There was no follow-up of these targets.
event_text: the sirotem surveys indicated a number of extremely conductive sediments existed near the base of the bangemall succession which was interpreted as black shales from the jillawarra formation. there was also a nearvertical source thought to be a target within the ashburton formation below the bangemall group located south west of cra explorations tenements. there was no follow up of these targets. examination of radiometric data by cra exploration identified six uranium anomalies of possible interest; however no work was completed on them.

sentence_text: Examination of radiometric data by CRA Exploration identified six uranium anomalies of possible interest; however no work was completed on them.
event_text: there was also a nearvertical source thought to be a target within the ashburton formation below the bangemall group located south west of cra explorations tenements. there was no follow up of these targets. examination of radiometric data by cra exploration identified six uranium anomalies of possible interest; however no work was completed on them. newcrest began exploration of the area in 1989 and acquired 13 contiguous els.

sentence_text: A total of 1072m of RC drilling (15 holes) were completed along 30km strike length of the Peebeezee horizon.
event_text: pasminco exploration entered into a jv with newcrest in march 1993. during that year mapping and rock chip sampling was completed which highlighted a number of cross structures which are believed to have controlled sedimentation. a total of 1072m of rc drilling (15 holes) were completed along 30km strike length of the peebeezee horizon. a weak sphalerite and chalcopyrite mineralised sequence at the base of the jillawarra formation was located.

sentence_text: Eight RC drill holes totalling 777m were drilled with the best result being 8m @ 0.53% in hole PBZ20.
event_text: in the second year these holes were gamma logged and there was further rock chip sampling and geological mapping completed. an aeromagnetic survey was flown over the tenement at 200m line spacing highlighting the intense magnetic feature of the hughes anomaly. eight rc drill holes totalling 777m were drilled with the best result being 8m @ 0.53% in hole pbz20. encounter resources ltds pingandy creek project (e08 1578, e081779 and e08 1794) is located approximately 84kms south of paraburdoo w.a.

sentence_text: Activities conducted by Encounter during the tenure held included the collation of historical data, the acquisition and interpretation of a series of hyperspectral images over the tenement area, field reconnaissance visits to the project and a review of historical drill hole HD1.
event_text: the south eastern half of the project sits within the bounds of the nharnuwangga wajarri ngarlawangga (nwn) native title claim. the area of the nwn claim is covered by an indigenous land use agreement (ilua) between the state and the claimants, dated 5 july 2001. activities conducted by encounter during the tenure held included the collation of historical data, the acquisition and interpretation of a series of hyperspectral images over the tenement area, field reconnaissance visits to the project and a review of historical drill hole hd1. interpretation of old data and hyperspectral work in the area did not identify any anomalism requiring followup work.

sentence_text: APPENDIX NUMBER TITLE 1 Vacuum Drill Hole Locations and Assays 1.0 SUMMARY E38/1585 "Adam Range" encloses a poorly-exposed greenstone belt situated 25 km northeast of Laverton, W.A.
event_text: appendix number title 1 vacuum drill hole locations and assays 1.0 summary e38 1585 "adam range" encloses a poorly exposed greenstone belt situated 25 km northeast of laverton, w.a. only about 1.0 km strike of the belt is exposed in lateritised subcrops in the northern part tenement, though it is magnetically interpreted to extend to the north under deep transported regolith.

sentence_text: The tenement was acquired for its potential to host gold mineralisation associated with structural targets derived from aeromagnetic interpretation, and Windarra-type nickel sulphide targets associated with ultramafic components of the greenstone belt.
event_text: appendix number title 1 vacuum drill hole locations and assays 1.0 summary e38 1585 "adam range" encloses a poorly exposed greenstone belt situated 25 km northeast of laverton, w.a. only about 1.0 km strike of the belt is exposed in lateritised subcrops in the northern part tenement, though it is magnetically interpreted to extend to the north under deep transported regolith. the tenement was acquired for its potential to host gold mineralisation associated with structural targets derived from aeromagnetic interpretation, and windarra type nickel sulphide targets associated with ultramafic components of the greenstone belt. except for a single reconnaissance rock chip sample which assayed 9.4 gm t au, there is no known gold or other mineralisation within the tenement.

sentence_text: Except for a single reconnaissance rock chip sample which assayed 9.4 gm/t Au, there is no known gold or other mineralisation within the tenement.
event_text: only about 1.0 km strike of the belt is exposed in lateritised subcrops in the northern part tenement, though it is magnetically interpreted to extend to the north under deep transported regolith. the tenement was acquired for its potential to host gold mineralisation associated with structural targets derived from aeromagnetic interpretation, and windarra type nickel sulphide targets associated with ultramafic components of the greenstone belt. except for a single reconnaissance rock chip sample which assayed 9.4 gm t au, there is no known gold or other mineralisation within the tenement. the structural targets were tested by a base of hardpan vacuum drilling programme.

sentence_text: The vacuum drill geochemistry at the northern end of the tenement defined a linear 10-18 ppb Au anomaly, as well as several Cu-Ni-Pt-Pd anomalies associated with ultramafics.
event_text: the structural targets were tested by a base of hardpan vacuum drilling programme. some of the holes did not reach bedrock due to transported regolith. the vacuum drill geochemistry at the northern end of the tenement defined a linear 10 18 ppb au anomaly, as well as several cu ni pt pd anomalies associated with ultramafics. drill results showed the greenstone belt included a 250m wide talccarbonate serpentinite ultramafic between granites to the west and metabasalts to the east.

sentence_text: Drill results showed the greenstone belt included a 250m-wide talccarbonate/serpentinite ultramafic between granites to the west and metabasalts to the east.
event_text: some of the holes did not reach bedrock due to transported regolith. the vacuum drill geochemistry at the northern end of the tenement defined a linear 10 18 ppb au anomaly, as well as several cu ni pt pd anomalies associated with ultramafics. drill results showed the greenstone belt included a 250m wide talccarbonate serpentinite ultramafic between granites to the west and metabasalts to the east. surface gold anomalism is related to lateral dispersion along ferricrete horizons, and is interpreted to represent supergene dispersion around steep dipping higher grade mineralisation in ultramafics which was not intersected by the reconnaissance drilling.

sentence_text: Surface gold anomalism is related to lateral dispersion along ferricrete horizons, and is interpreted to represent supergene dispersion around steep-dipping higher grade mineralisation in ultramafics which was not intersected by the reconnaissance drilling.
event_text: the vacuum drill geochemistry at the northern end of the tenement defined a linear 10 18 ppb au anomaly, as well as several cu ni pt pd anomalies associated with ultramafics. drill results showed the greenstone belt included a 250m wide talccarbonate serpentinite ultramafic between granites to the west and metabasalts to the east. surface gold anomalism is related to lateral dispersion along ferricrete horizons, and is interpreted to represent supergene dispersion around steep dipping higher grade mineralisation in ultramafics which was not intersected by the reconnaissance drilling. the gold anomalism occurs as two en echelon north striking zones separated by offset along the east west fault, and is open to the north.

sentence_text: Although no nickel targets were specifically determined the limited drilling did not test the entire width of the main ultramafic body, and that further potential exists for exploration along internal discontinuities between sub-units.
event_text: nickel, copper, platinum and palladium showed supergene effects in weathered and oxidised parts of the profile, their values diminishing in fresh rock. no coincidence of these elements that might indicate sulphides could be unequivocally demonstrated in the assay results. although no nickel targets were specifically determined the limited drilling did not test the entire width of the main ultramafic body, and that further potential exists for exploration along internal discontinuities between sub units. a study is proposed combining ground magnetics with careful re logging of drill cuttings to determine such discontinuities.

sentence_text: A 500m-wide north-striking greenstone belt is present in the northern part of the tenement, comprising talc-carbonate ultramafics, serpentinites, minor cherty BIF, and amphibolites to the east.
event_text: 4.0 geological setting much of e38 1585 is covered by sandplain comprising indurated transported and residual regolith, mainly overlying archaean granitoids which are traversed by major nw faults. the majority of bedrock outcrops occur in the north of the tenement, comprising foliated to massive granites, variably weathered at surface, and capped by silcrete. a 500m wide north striking greenstone belt is present in the northern part of the tenement, comprising talc carbonate ultramafics, serpentinites, minor cherty bif, and amphibolites to the east. the belt is poorly exposed in lateritised subcrops along 1 km of strike to the south of the great central road.

sentence_text: The belt is poorly exposed in lateritised subcrops along 1 km of strike to the south of the Great Central Road.
event_text: the majority of bedrock outcrops occur in the north of the tenement, comprising foliated to massive granites, variably weathered at surface, and capped by silcrete. a 500m wide north striking greenstone belt is present in the northern part of the tenement, comprising talc carbonate ultramafics, serpentinites, minor cherty bif, and amphibolites to the east. the belt is poorly exposed in lateritised subcrops along 1 km of strike to the south of the great central road. 5.0 mineralisation except for a single reconnaissance rock chip sample arr 8 which assayed 9.4 gm t au there is no known mineralisation within e38 1585.

sentence_text: The historic Hogans Find Gold Mine, which is immediately to the east of the Project area, has a recorded production of 314.5 tonnes of ore, at an average grade of 27.35g/t gold up to 1904, together with 909 ounces of alluvial gold.
event_text: these exploration activities are depicted on the exploration index map figure 1. m26 477 terrain minerals ltd coogee project exploration index map combined reporting status c1482001 western austral ia perth kalgoorlie coogee project 380000me 6560000mn 6550000mn lake lefroy coogee au deposit 390000me e26 97 28 mile dam kam bald a car nilya hill n 5km0 gda94 zone 51 ground gravity survey & geological mapping (1:5,000) ip em survey cgc1482001a2008 figure 1 1 cgc1482001a2008 coogee project 2008 annual report 1.0 introduction the coogee project has been subjected to sporadic exploration, principally for nickel and gold, since the late 1960s early 1970s. the historic hogans find gold mine, which is immediately to the east of the project area, has a recorded production of 314.5 tonnes of ore, at an average grade of 27.35g t gold up to 1904, together with 909 ounces of alluvial gold. previous work by terrain minerals has focused on the coogee gold deposit, to the east of the aztec dome, and various geophysical targets to the west of the aztec dome.

sentence_text: Exploration activities during 2008 concentrated on the Aztec Dome portion of E26/97 and included a geophysical data review, acquisition of historic ground IP data, a ground gravity survey, a combined ground EM / IP survey, geological mapping and drafting, and geophysical interpretation of all available ground and airborne data along with small programs of petrography and whole rock and minor element analyses.
event_text: on 01 102008 two of the then four project leases, namely m26 478 and m26 485, were removed from the combined reporting group. fifty percent of e26 97 was compulsorily surrendered in april 2008 and previous project leases, m26 478 and m26 485, were surrendered on 20 09 2008 and have been reported separately as individual surrender reports. exploration activities during 2008 concentrated on the aztec dome portion of e26 97 and included a geophysical data review, acquisition of historic ground ip data, a ground gravity survey, a combined ground em ip survey, geological mapping and drafting, and geophysical interpretation of all available ground and airborne data along with small programs of petrography and whole rock and minor element analyses. 2.0 location and access the coogee project is located 20km northeast of kambalda, and 55km south of kalgoorlie, on the north side of lake lefroy.

sentence_text: The historic Hogans Find Gold Mine is located to the immediate east of the Project area and is accessed by way of a series of tracks from the north.
event_text: monger road to mount monger homestead, and thence south to the carnilya hill mine site. the southern part of the project area straddles lake lefroy. the historic hogans find gold mine is located to the immediate east of the project area and is accessed by way of a series of tracks from the north. most of the area is impassable in wet weather as it is traversed by a series of drainage channels and flood plains which feed in to lake lefroy.

sentence_text: Regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and high-Mg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons.
event_text: to the north, the domain limits terminate south of the carnilya anticline at the east trending talcum fault, a major thrust that separates the parker domain from its northern neighbour, the boorara domain. one hundred and twenty kilometres to the south southeast granitoids of the norseman terrane close out the parker domains southward continuation. regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and high mg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons. the outcropping greenstones of the parker domain appear to relate regionally with the upper basalt unit and felsic volcanic sedimentary unit of the adjacent kambalda domain.

sentence_text: However in the east, the sedimentary rocks contain magnetite-rich BIF horizons which may be more closely associated with the adjacent BIFbearing sedimentary rocks of the Kurnalpi Terrane.
event_text: regional mapping of the domain, combined with interpretation of aeromagnetic data, indicates the presence of quite extensive areas of metamorphosed tholeiitic and high mg basalts, ultramafic rocks, sediments, felsic volcanics, and volcaniclastic rocks intruded by granitoid plutons. the outcropping greenstones of the parker domain appear to relate regionally with the upper basalt unit and felsic volcanic sedimentary unit of the adjacent kambalda domain. however in the east, the sedimentary rocks contain magnetite rich bif horizons which may be more closely associated with the adjacent bifbearing sedimentary rocks of the kurnalpi terrane. any comparisons drawn are tenuous as much of the parker domain, to date, has been only lightly explored and cursorily mapped.

sentence_text: The Dome has two distinct sides; the western half contains some highly magnetic basalt units, while the eastern half has moderately magnetic basalts with thin interflow sediments.
event_text: a manual interpretation of the sovereign resouces 1996 uts aeromagnetics and the atlas geophysics 2008 gravity data over the aztec dome was completed by fathom geophysics (appendix 9). geological mapping was supplied by terrain minerals. the dome has two distinct sides; the western half contains some highly magnetic basalt units, while the eastern half has moderately magnetic basalts with thin interflow sediments. the dome is surrounded by sediments and intermediate to felsic tuffs.

sentence_text: The eastern half has five possible felsic intrusives; one is apparent on the gravity while the others are apparent on the magnetics.
event_text: the dome has two distinct sides; the western half contains some highly magnetic basalt units, while the eastern half has moderately magnetic basalts with thin interflow sediments. the dome is surrounded by sediments and intermediate to felsic tuffs. the eastern half has five possible felsic intrusives; one is apparent on the gravity while the others are apparent on the magnetics. the western edge of the dome shows rapid changes in both the gravity and magnetic data interpreted as a steeply west dipping shear while the eastern half is more shallow dipping and stratigraphic.

sentence_text: The nickel mineralisation occurs at the contact between the host serpentinised komatiites (Kambalda Komatiite unit) and footwall basalts (Lunnon Basalt unit).

sentence_text: A diamond drill hole on the eastern half of the Dome indicates that the basalts have a stratigraphic thickness of around three hundred meters and that thin interflow sediments are concentrated near the top of the basalt sequence.
event_text: integration of the geological mapping with low level aeromagnetic data and ground gravity data has delineated the outline of the aztec dome, its major shears and felsic intrusions. the northwest trending aztec dome is breached axially by a shear occupied by the parkeston dyke. a diamond drill hole on the eastern half of the dome indicates that the basalts have a stratigraphic thickness of around three hundred meters and that thin interflow sediments are concentrated near the top of the basalt sequence. the eastern side of the dome is intruded by four, small quartz syenite plugs that are oriented northwest.

sentence_text: The two chip samples from historic Aztec Exploration reverse circulation drill holes on its Southern Anomaly are micro-porphyritic and aphyric basalts, from the middle and top of the basalt pile, and the stratigaphically lowest sample, from the shore of Lake Lefroy, is a high magnesian (komatiitic) basalt, with preserved (expyroxene) spinifex textures in centimeter sized ovoids.
event_text: the fourth sample was a syenite intrusive. primary textures are partially preserved. the two chip samples from historic aztec exploration reverse circulation drill holes on its southern anomaly are micro porphyritic and aphyric basalts, from the middle and top of the basalt pile, and the stratigaphically lowest sample, from the shore of lake lefroy, is a high magnesian (komatiitic) basalt, with preserved (expyroxene) spinifex textures in centimeter sized ovoids. the intrusive is a late aegerine bearing quartz syenite with no regional metamorphic overprint.

sentence_text: The drill hole stratigraphy is a sequence of orthoamphibolites (metabasalts) with intercalations of slumped tuffaceous and chemically derived sediments (cherts, jaspers).
event_text: kambalda east project aztec dome geological mapping 2008 10 238.08 283.90m altered fractured orthoamphibolites and volcanic breccias. 283.90 287.59m dark green actinolitic orthoamphibolite (possible intrusive) 287.59 292.55m siliceous dyke like intrusion and zone of brecciation. the drill hole stratigraphy is a sequence of orthoamphibolites (metabasalts) with intercalations of slumped tuffaceous and chemically derived sediments (cherts, jaspers). the orthoamphibolites exhibit considerable fragmentation which can mostly be attributed to the brecciation of individual lava flow tops though some tectonic brecciation is also evident.

sentence_text: Other intervals have considerable pyrite and pyrrhotite mineralisation which generally occur as disseminations and veinlets.
event_text: most diagnostic igneous textures have been obliterated by silica, epidotite, potash, sulphide and carbonate metasomatism. this has resulted in sections of the core exhibiting classic quartz carbonate stockwork structures. other intervals have considerable pyrite and pyrrhotite mineralisation which generally occur as disseminations and veinlets. some of the orthoamphibolites show variolitic, micro amygdaloidal and coalescing patchy textures which enables a crude differentiation to be made between lithotypes amphibolite 1 and 2.

sentence_text: Some of the orthoamphibolites show variolitic, micro-amygdaloidal and coalescing patchy textures which enables a crude differentiation to be made between lithotypes Amphibolite 1 and 2.

sentence_text: Rock Samples A collection of 4 drill chip and outcrop rock samples from the Kambalda East Project (Aztec Dome, Yilgarn Craton, Western Australia) has been studied using routine optical petrographic methods.

event_text: mason geoscience pty ltd report #3462 2 october 2008 4 terrain minerals ltd 1 introduction a collection of 4 rock samples was received from mr bob jeffery (terrain minerals ltd, west perth, western australia) on 2 september 2008. background information was provided, indicating the samples originate from the kambalda east project of terrain minerals, located in the aztec dome approximately 15 km ne of kambalda. the samples represent surface grab rock samples and drill chip samples. field comments were provided for the samples, and a spreadsheet indicated specific sample details.

sentence_text: APPENDIX 2 PARKESTON DYKE DATA CGC1482001A2008 Coogee Project 2008 Annual Report PARKESTON DYKE The regionally extensive Parkeston Dyke is a narrow, north-northwest trending crustal structure subparallel to the Boulder Lefroy and Mount Monger Faults, which are major structures within the Kalgoorlie Terrane of the Archaean Eastern Goldfields Supergroup.
event_text: 8: sample 101092 (transmitted light, crossed polarisers, obj. x10, image pa013748) this view illustrates the presence of opaques (black, centre, most likely sulphide such as ?pyrrhotite) which formed as part of the proximal alteration assemblage with plagioclase (grey) and biotite (reddish flakes) in strongly altered meta basic host rock adjacent to quartz rich vein (bottom). appendix 2 parkeston dyke data cgc1482001a2008 coogee project 2008 annual report parkeston dyke the regionally extensive parkeston dyke is a narrow, north northwest trending crustal structure subparallel to the boulder lefroy and mount monger faults, which are major structures within the kalgoorlie terrane of the archaean eastern goldfields supergroup. the parkeston dyke is a poorly documented and poorly outcropping structure which extends for over 100km from the golden mile area of kalgoorlie (and probably further to the northwest) to the southeast of lake cowan on the yardina map sheet (1:100,000 reference 3334), where it is probably terminated against the albany fraser orogen.

sentence_text: This dolerite could be Archaean, but if the dolerite is a correlative of the Widgiemooltha Dyke Suite, then its age is approximately 2420 Ma - the extensive east-northeast trending Binneringie Dyke and Jimberlana Dyke have been dated at 2418Ma and 2411Ma respectively.
event_text: the parkeston dyke is a poorly documented and poorly outcropping structure which extends for over 100km from the golden mile area of kalgoorlie (and probably further to the northwest) to the southeast of lake cowan on the yardina map sheet (1:100,000 reference 3334), where it is probably terminated against the albany fraser orogen. its age is unknown, but it is probably a reactivated archaean structure which is now locally occupied by dolerite. this dolerite could be archaean, but if the dolerite is a correlative of the widgiemooltha dyke suite, then its age is approximately 2420 ma the extensive east northeast trending binneringie dyke and jimberlana dyke have been dated at 2418ma and 2411ma respectively. if the dolerite is a later feature associated with the notheasterly trending albany fraser orogen then its age is approximately 1210 + 10 ma.

event_text: two hp laptop computers for data download and processing one magellan fx324 autonomous gps receivers for navigation one iridium satellite phones for long distance communications personal protective equipment for all personnel batteries, battery chargers, solar cells, ups system survey consumables tools, engineering and maintenance equipment for vehicle servicing first aid and survival kits tyres and recovery equipment two hydraulic jacks 3.0 acquisition of the gravity data gravity data were acquired concurrently with gps glonass data using scintrex cg5 gravity meters (photo 1). data were acquired in a single shift of 10 hours duration, with each shift consisting of a single loop controlled by observations at the gravity control stations. each loop contained a minimum of two repeated readings so that an interlocking network of closed loops was formed. a total of 5% repeats were acquired for quality control purposes.

sentence_text: The only prominent topographic features are low extensive scarps or breakaways that commonly mark an abrupt junction between the old and new plateau surfaces and only occur in deeply weathered or kaolinized rock.
event_text: this road is well maintained and cuts across much of the tenement group. the topography is subdued and characterized by low rounded hills with the relief ranging between 100 and 200m. the only prominent topographic features are low extensive scarps or breakaways that commonly mark an abrupt junction between the old and new plateau surfaces and only occur in deeply weathered or kaolinized rock. the climate is semi arid with an annual average rainfall of between 225 250mm.

sentence_text: On the western side of the shear zone, the bedrock sequence comprises basalts, komatiites, sediments and minor felsic volcanics.
event_text: flanking the belt are major archaean intrusive granitic bodies. the major structural feature of the property area is the northnorthwest trending avoca shear zone that dips to the west. on the western side of the shear zone, the bedrock sequence comprises basalts, komatiites, sediments and minor felsic volcanics. to the east of the avoca shear, the sequence is dominated by basalt, dolerite and sediments and in the easternmost portions of the kurnalpi property by felsic volcanic rocks.

sentence_text: Rainfall in the area varies from light falls during winter to heavier, patchy falls in summer and autumn.
event_text: access to the tenure from kalgoorlie is via the yarri road through kanowna townsite towards gindalbie (refer: location plan figure 1). the climate is semi arid with an annual rainfall of about 250mm and annual evaporation of about 2300mm. rainfall in the area varies from light falls during winter to heavier, patchy falls in summer and autumn. in some instances this region can become flooded due to very heavy rains brought about by tropical cyclones which move in from the northwest (ahmat, 1995).

sentence_text: This region differs from the domains to the west with minor volumes of metabasalt and metakomatiite and more prolific calc-alkaline andesitic complexes with associated clastic rocks as well as BIF, chert and metasedimentary sequences intruded by metadolerite (Swager,1995a,1997).
event_text: regionally the geology of the edjudina 1:100,000 sheet is characterised by granites intruding or in fault contact with archaean rocks which include sediments, felsic and mafic volcanics. the region falls within the edjudina terrane (swager et al., 1990) of the eastern goldfields province and is bound by the claypan fault to the west and the pinjin fault to the east. this region differs from the domains to the west with minor volumes of metabasalt and metakomatiite and more prolific calc alkaline andesitic complexes with associated clastic rocks as well as bif, chert and metasedimentary sequences intruded by metadolerite (swager,1995a,1997). the region has undergone greenschist metamorphism although high grades upto amphibolite can occur close to granite margins.

sentence_text: Heavy medium separation of a coarse fraction of the samples returned a concentrate grading 57-61% Fe with a 21% recovery.
event_text: five iron rich samples were sent for metallurgical test work to determine whether they could produce a saleable product. average head grade of the samples was ~20% fe. heavy medium separation of a coarse fraction of the samples returned a concentrate grading 57 61% fe with a 21% recovery. recommendations were made for a more thorough sampling of the alluvial material, including channel sampling and shallow percussion drilling.

sentence_text: Prodemas proposed a mining model to extract hematite from the alluvial gravels within the Seven Mile and Turee Creek systems, and postulate a potential resource of one billion tonnes by multiplying the surface extent of mapped alluvium by a nominal thickness of 5m.

sentence_text: 8 While the Ashburton Formation is generally magnetically bland, it contains several small magnetic markers which are mapped as trend lines and probably reflect heavy mineral layers within the sediments.
event_text: examination of the uranium channel data yields peak anomalies of approximately 5 ppm eu which can be generally be related to northeast trending lineaments, suggesting the uranium anomalies may be due to weak hydrothermal alteration. 7 figure 2: geophysical images for the ashburton project area ternary radiometrics (top) first vertical derivative of magnetics (middle) and first vertical derivative of gravity (bottom). 8 while the ashburton formation is generally magnetically bland, it contains several small magnetic markers which are mapped as trend lines and probably reflect heavy mineral layers within the sediments. several narrow, moderate amplitude magnetic anomalies are interpreted as thin bif units, although field checking is required to validate these.

sentence_text: The Ashburton Project was acquired by Polaris for its iron ore potential, specifically to explore for concealed detrital (alluvial haematite sourced from the Paraburdoo Ranges) or channel iron deposits.
event_text: stratigraphic contacts were interpreted using the magnetic and radiometric markers described above. a number of structural elements were also mapped, including a dominantly ne trending fault set and several dolerite dykes interpreted from distinctive negative magnetic lineaments. the ashburton project was acquired by polaris for its iron ore potential, specifically to explore for concealed detrital (alluvial haematite sourced from the paraburdoo ranges) or channel iron deposits. the exploration work completed to date has failed to successfully define either of these deposit types within the portions of the project tenements subject to this report.

sentence_text: REGIONAL GEOLOGICAL SETTING (after Thorne et al, 1991) The Ashburton Project tenements are situated in the central to northern section of the Ashburton Basin (a NW-SE trending elongate sedimentary depositional zone approximately 330 km long by 70 km wide) containing poorly exposed middle Proterozoic Wyloo Group sediments (Figure 2).
event_text: the subject tenements were officially transferred to polaris on 4 may 2007. ochre signed and registered a heritage agreement with the innowonga (w98 069) claim group; gobawarrah mindurarra yinhawanga (wc97 043) claim group; and the jurruru (wc00 008) claim group through the yamatji marlpa barna baba maaja aboriginal corporation (ymbbmac). regional geological setting (after thorne et al, 1991) the ashburton project tenements are situated in the central to northern section of the ashburton basin (a nw se trending elongate sedimentary depositional zone approximately 330 km long by 70 km wide) containing poorly exposed middle proterozoic wyloo group sediments (figure 2). a widespread blanket of quaternary alluvium and colluvium forms a wide floodplain to the northwest flowing ashburton river and tributaries including the southwest flowing turee ad seven mile creeks.

sentence_text: An extensive, but discontinuous Cainozoic cover of silcrete, calcrete, laterite, colluvium, alluvium, and pisolite unconformably overlies the Wyloo Group which is intruded by late Proterozoic Phanerozoic dolerite dykes & sills.
event_text: regional geological setting (after thorne et al, 1991) the ashburton project tenements are situated in the central to northern section of the ashburton basin (a nw se trending elongate sedimentary depositional zone approximately 330 km long by 70 km wide) containing poorly exposed middle proterozoic wyloo group sediments (figure 2). a widespread blanket of quaternary alluvium and colluvium forms a wide floodplain to the northwest flowing ashburton river and tributaries including the southwest flowing turee ad seven mile creeks. an extensive, but discontinuous cainozoic cover of silcrete, calcrete, laterite, colluvium, alluvium, and pisolite unconformably overlies the wyloo group which is intruded by late proterozoic phanerozoic dolerite dykes & sills. the upper wyloo group unit is the ashburton formation comprising a metapelite psammite sequence with interbedded basic volcanics, banded iron formation (bif), chert, ferruginous pelite and local metaconglomerate.

sentence_text: Conformably underlying the Ashburton Formation is the Duck Creek Dolomite (thinthick bedded, locally stromatolitic metadolomite; metadolorudite, minor chert, and pelite).
event_text: an extensive, but discontinuous cainozoic cover of silcrete, calcrete, laterite, colluvium, alluvium, and pisolite unconformably overlies the wyloo group which is intruded by late proterozoic phanerozoic dolerite dykes & sills. the upper wyloo group unit is the ashburton formation comprising a metapelite psammite sequence with interbedded basic volcanics, banded iron formation (bif), chert, ferruginous pelite and local metaconglomerate. conformably underlying the ashburton formation is the duck creek dolomite (thinthick bedded, locally stromatolitic metadolomite; metadolorudite, minor chert, and pelite). the underlying unit is the conformable mount mcgrath formation (ferruginous metasandstone and metaconglomerate; pelite and metadolomite).

sentence_text: The basal unit is the Beasley River Quartzite (fine- to coarse-grained quartzitic metasandstone and pelite; minor metadolerite sills) which conformably underlies the Cheela Springs Basalt.
event_text: the underlying unit is the conformable mount mcgrath formation (ferruginous metasandstone and metaconglomerate; pelite and metadolomite). the cheela springs basalt (vesicular & amygdaloidal metabasalt, metatuff, and metasandstone) unconformably underlies the mount mcgrath formation. the basal unit is the beasley river quartzite (fine to coarse grained quartzitic metasandstone and pelite; minor metadolerite sills) which conformably underlies the cheela springs basalt. in a regional context the wyloo group defines the nw se trending ashburton basin which has been subject to several deformation phases producing a series of nw se striking synforms and figure 2a: turee creek 1:250,000 geological map sheet legend ashburton project partial surrender report 2008 polaris metals nl page 2 antiforms with reverse plunges common along strike.

sentence_text: The Project area is extensively covered by alluvial deposits along the outflow of the Seven Mile and Turee Creek systems, which drain from iron mineralisation in the Paraburdoo Range, approximately 7km to the north.
event_text: the ashburton project consists of four tenements covering a total area of 670.6 km2 located approximately 15 20km south of the township of paraburdoo, wa. basement geology within the project area almost entirely consists of proterozoic sediments of the ashburton formation, with a narrow keel of capricorn formation preserved within a wnw trending synclinal axis. the project area is extensively covered by alluvial deposits along the outflow of the seven mile and turee creek systems, which drain from iron mineralisation in the paraburdoo range, approximately 7km to the north. the ashburton project tenements were acquired by polaris from ochre resources heron resources for the potential to host detrital and channel iron deposits.

sentence_text: The Ashburton Project tenements were acquired by Polaris from Ochre Resources / Heron Resources for the potential to host detrital and channel iron deposits.
event_text: basement geology within the project area almost entirely consists of proterozoic sediments of the ashburton formation, with a narrow keel of capricorn formation preserved within a wnw trending synclinal axis. the project area is extensively covered by alluvial deposits along the outflow of the seven mile and turee creek systems, which drain from iron mineralisation in the paraburdoo range, approximately 7km to the north. the ashburton project tenements were acquired by polaris from ochre resources heron resources for the potential to host detrital and channel iron deposits. previous work by ochre polaris has focussed on trying to upgrade the alluvial fan material into a saleable product.

sentence_text: Past workers have also identified the potential for fault hosted copper-gold mineralisation around Mt Elephant in the southern part of the Project area.
event_text: processing testwork suggested that iron rich material taken from the project could be upgraded to a 60% fe product. however, further bulk sample testwork of alluvial material is required to verify this result to support a mining proposal. past workers have also identified the potential for fault hosted copper gold mineralisation around mt elephant in the southern part of the project area. best results from orientation geochemical surveys include assays of up to 10.24% cu and 2.17 g t au at the elephant north prospect.

sentence_text: Three holes drilled into the Mt Elephant prospect yielded a best intersection of 5m @ 1.3% Cu within a gossan also containing trace amounts of gold, silver and cobalt.
event_text: past workers have also identified the potential for fault hosted copper gold mineralisation around mt elephant in the southern part of the project area. best results from orientation geochemical surveys include assays of up to 10.24% cu and 2.17 g t au at the elephant north prospect. three holes drilled into the mt elephant prospect yielded a best intersection of 5m @ 1.3% cu within a gossan also containing trace amounts of gold, silver and cobalt. gossans similar to mt elephant would also have the potential to host a small resource of dso hematite ore. further exploration for channel iron deposits and dso hematite within the minor ashburton formation bifs is considered warranted, along with further review of the copper gold potential of the project area.

sentence_text: Gossans similar to Mt Elephant would also have the potential to host a small resource of DSO hematite ore. Further exploration for channel iron deposits and DSO hematite within the minor Ashburton Formation BIFs is considered warranted, along with further review of the copper-gold potential of the Project area.
event_text: best results from orientation geochemical surveys include assays of up to 10.24% cu and 2.17 g t au at the elephant north prospect. three holes drilled into the mt elephant prospect yielded a best intersection of 5m @ 1.3% cu within a gossan also containing trace amounts of gold, silver and cobalt. gossans similar to mt elephant would also have the potential to host a small resource of dso hematite ore. further exploration for channel iron deposits and dso hematite within the minor ashburton formation bifs is considered warranted, along with further review of the copper gold potential of the project area. the following recommendations for further work are made: a helicopter em survey flown over the entire project area to help map the thickness of alluvial material and directly target for concealed channel iron deposits.

sentence_text: A detailed, low level magnetic and radiometric survey to refine the interpretation of the Ashburton BIFs and possible structures hosting copper-gold mineralisation.
event_text: the following recommendations for further work are made: a helicopter em survey flown over the entire project area to help map the thickness of alluvial material and directly target for concealed channel iron deposits. representative bulk sampling of the alluvial fan material to validate the conceptual resource and feasibility of mining and upgrading this material. a detailed, low level magnetic and radiometric survey to refine the interpretation of the ashburton bifs and possible structures hosting copper gold mineralisation. review and further evaluation of the copper gold potential of the project area.

sentence_text: It is a 5-12 km thick, low-metamorphic grade metasedimentary sequence consisting of (Was) sandstones (psammites) and (Wam) mudstone (pelites), with minor intervals of mafic and felsic volcanics, conglomerate, chert and iron-formation.
event_text: outcrops of older wyloo group stratigraphy, mt mcgrath formation (wm) and duck creek dolomite (wd), occur to the northeast of the project area. the ashburton formation is the uppermost unit of the wyloo group. it is a 5 12 km thick, low metamorphic grade metasedimentary sequence consisting of (was) sandstones (psammites) and (wam) mudstone (pelites), with minor intervals of mafic and felsic volcanics, conglomerate, chert and iron formation. banded iron formations occur as thin beds (0.01 to 0.5 m thick) and are estimated to represent <1% of the entire formation.

sentence_text: Tertiary age deposits of silcrete, calcrete and laterite are also found throughout the Project area.
event_text: the capricorn formation (r) is an 800m thick sequence of metasedimentary rocks which unconformably overlies the wyloo group. the project area is extensively covered by colluvial and alluvial deposits particularly along the outflow of the seven mile and turee creek systems. tertiary age deposits of silcrete, calcrete and laterite are also found throughout the project area. polaris constructed gis datasets of the ochre rock chip sampling and obtained public domain aeromagnetic, geology, and mineral occurrence data in mapinfo format.

sentence_text: Spatial analysis revealed possible palaeodrainages originating from the Brockman Iron Formation to the north along weak linear magnetic features associated with Turee Creek (E08/1511-I and E08/1513-I) and Seven Mile Creek (E08/1512-I).
event_text: tertiary age deposits of silcrete, calcrete and laterite are also found throughout the project area. polaris constructed gis datasets of the ochre rock chip sampling and obtained public domain aeromagnetic, geology, and mineral occurrence data in mapinfo format. spatial analysis revealed possible palaeodrainages originating from the brockman iron formation to the north along weak linear magnetic features associated with turee creek (e08 1511 i and e08 1513 i) and seven mile creek (e08 1512 i). a nw se trending linear magnetic low zone bifurcating e08 1511 i corresponds to an outcropping late proterozoic dolerite dyke mapped by the gswa to the west of e45 1511i.

event_text: discussion and conclusions the ashburton project was acquired by polaris for its iron ore potential, specifically to explore for concealed detrital (alluvial hematite sourced from the paraburdoo ranges) or channel iron deposits. the exploration work completed to date has failed to successfully explore for either of these deposit types. ochre resources polaris has focussed largely on evaluating the abundant alluvial material for potential upgrade to an iron concentrate. however several limitations in this assessment are noted; the limited sampling completed so far is clustered and it does not appear that any attempt has been made to collect a sample representative of the full width of the alluvial channels.

sentence_text: All of the terranes contain volcanosedimentary assemblages of a similar age deposited in separate but possibly adjoining basins and share the same history of granitic magmatism and tectonism (Swager, 1997).
event_text: the eastern goldfields province forms the eastern part of the yilgarn craton and is separated from its western neighbor, the southern cross province, by the regional nnw trending ida fault. the eastern goldfields province has been further subdivided into structuralstratigraphic terranes bounded by regional nnw oriented faults (swager, 1997). all of the terranes contain volcanosedimentary assemblages of a similar age deposited in separate but possibly adjoining basins and share the same history of granitic magmatism and tectonism (swager, 1997). tenement p27 1612 is located within the gindalbie terrane in the southern portion of the eastern goldfields province.

sentence_text: It is possible that the timing of peak metamorphism varied across the region because of differences in emplacement ages of various granitoid bodies.

sentence_text: The feldspar-quartz porphyry (Afp) units contain large, irregular, zoned plagioclase phenocrysts and scattered, small bluish quartz phenocrysts in a fine- to medium-grained matrix of feldspar, quartz and biotite with minor opaques, apatite, zircon and secondary muscovite and epidote.
event_text: the rocks are mostly weakly foliated. layering is defined by different amounts, ratios and grain sizes of phenocryst phases and by interleaved, thin, fragmental, tuffaceous or biotite rich beds. the feldspar quartz porphyry (afp) units contain large, irregular, zoned plagioclase phenocrysts and scattered, small bluish quartz phenocrysts in a fine to medium grained matrix of feldspar, quartz and biotite with minor opaques, apatite, zircon and secondary muscovite and epidote. in some parts of the porphyry, both plagioclase and rounded quartz pheocrysts occur within a matrix of perthitic and granophyric feldspars, quartz and biotite.

event_text: dawson hinkler centipede catchment area (from crabb et al., 1984) 2 u3o8 limited centipede catchment system (from crabb et al., 1984) understanding of the host rock(s) is limited due to the wide spacing between drill holes however the calcrete consist dominantly of calcite, locally chalcedony rich with minor amounts of dolomite, gypsum and sepiolite. that horizon is sometimes underlain with kaolinitic and or smectite rich clay and in some cases by lateritic material (hematite and goethite rich, crabb et al., 1984). based on its geomorphology and mineralisation style, the dawson hinkler section of the drainage system can be described as a trunk valley calcrete as defined by butt et al. outcropping calcrete within the hinkler well centipede area typically is likely the result of a combination of the mounding (due to repeated rises and falls of the water table and development of sepiolite and magnesian swelling clays) and erosion and incision of the channel margins by the current drainage system.

Moreau) The distribution of the mineralisation at Dawson-Hinkler and the identification of separate mineralised pods suggest that the presence of subsurface barriers restricting ground water flow plays a major role in the uranium distribution in the calcrete.
event_text: the calcrete is usually structured as follows (where un eroded): the top few cm to 20cm consists of a finely laminated undulating calcrete horizon underlain by a brecciated and frequently recemented calcrete of variable thickness, developed in response to the swelling associated with clays a locally silica rich massive calcrete a transitional locally nodular calcrete trending into spotty channel clay and sands (with widespread calcite nodules). where outcropping, the calcrete at dawson hinkler frequently exhibit karst features with evidence of caving and slumping due to carbonate dissolution by rain waters (see photograph 1). 3 u3o8 limited photograph 1: typical karst features of out cropping calcrete at the hinkler prospect (photo: x. moreau) the distribution of the mineralisation at dawson hinkler and the identification of separate mineralised pods suggest that the presence of subsurface barriers restricting ground water flow plays a major role in the uranium distribution in the calcrete. subtle linear trends in both airborne radiometric and magnetic data coinciding with rapid changes in the depth of the recent alluvium colluvium cover which hosts the calcrete and the thickness of the latter support a partial structural control of the mineralised pods.

sentence_text: Various reports confirm that the uranium mineralisation occurs exclusively as the mineral carnotite, generally as coatings on vugs and fracture surfaces, distributed dominantly at or above the water table.
event_text: 3 u3o8 limited photograph 1: typical karst features of out cropping calcrete at the hinkler prospect (photo: x. moreau) the distribution of the mineralisation at dawson hinkler and the identification of separate mineralised pods suggest that the presence of subsurface barriers restricting ground water flow plays a major role in the uranium distribution in the calcrete. subtle linear trends in both airborne radiometric and magnetic data coinciding with rapid changes in the depth of the recent alluvium colluvium cover which hosts the calcrete and the thickness of the latter support a partial structural control of the mineralised pods. various reports confirm that the uranium mineralisation occurs exclusively as the mineral carnotite, generally as coatings on vugs and fracture surfaces, distributed dominantly at or above the water table. significant hydrogeochemical characterisation of the hinkler centipede drainage system has also taken place (mann et al., 1978).

event_text: this is consistent with the findings of radio chemical equilibrium reported by carpentaria for four samples of the hinkler prospect as reported in ashraf et al., 1972. 1 the disequilibrium ratio is defined as the ratio between chemical uranium and gamma uranium (u eu). u3o8 limited 6.0 conclusions and recommendations exploration activities in the first half of 2006 confirmed the potential of the dawsonhinkler drainage system for a significant calcrete hosted uranium mineral resource to be defined by 200m x 100m and or 400m x 100m spaced drill holes. the proposed activities for the coming year will aim to define the spatial extent of the mineralised calcrete sheet on the project to enable the calculation of a mineral resource estimate over the four main zones defined in the project review.

sentence_text: The geology consists of a sequence of tholeiitic and high-Mg basalts interlayered with minor komatiite units and differentiated mafic-ultramafic intrusives that have been thrust over younger felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks with ultramafic schist lenses in the south.
event_text: the tenements lie to the west of the randall fault zone, which forms the boundary between the mt. belches formation and the gindalbie terrane to the west. the geology consists of a sequence of tholeiitic and high mg basalts interlayered with minor komatiite units and differentiated mafic ultramafic intrusives that have been thrust over younger felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks with ultramafic schist lenses in the south. the mafic unit can be traced southwards around the anticline to mount monger.

sentence_text: Generally as the mafic unit is traced northwards it becomes thinner and contains progressively less ultramafic rocks and shows a change in basalt composition from high-Mg (pyroxene spinifex) to more tholeiitic (feldspar-phyric).
event_text: the mafic unit can be traced southwards around the anticline to mount monger. at mount monger the mafic unit comprises high mg basalt characterised by pyroxenespinifex textures on various scales and several major ultramafic mafic lenses, interpreted as intrusive sills. generally as the mafic unit is traced northwards it becomes thinner and contains progressively less ultramafic rocks and shows a change in basalt composition from high mg (pyroxene spinifex) to more tholeiitic (feldspar phyric). the eastern limb of the bulong anticline is relatively poorly endowed with gold mineralisation in comparison to the western limb.

sentence_text: The eastern limb of the Bulong Anticline is relatively poorly endowed with gold mineralisation in comparison to the western limb.

sentence_text: This ultramafic sequence was interpreted to be equivalent to the ultramafics which host Kambalda-style nickel mineralisation elsewhere in the Bulong anticline, such as at Blair and Carnilya Hill.
event_text: drilling was undertaken to test for ultramafic lithologies identified by gswa mapping and in historic drilling. results received for this drilling were encouraging, with anomalous ni results being recorded and an ultramafic sequence being identified. this ultramafic sequence was interpreted to be equivalent to the ultramafics which host kambalda style nickel mineralisation elsewhere in the bulong anticline, such as at blair and carnilya hill. the anomalous ni values are associated with talc schist and chlorite schist representing metamorphosed and sheared mafic and ultramafic volcanic rocks.

sentence_text: The regional stratigraphy of the Randall Hills Project comprises a sequence of felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks, with minor banded iron formation occurring within the upper portion of the volcaniclastic sequence (Jones and Hall, 2004), overlying an upper komatiitic basalt unit and a lower basaltic unit, that are separated by an intervening komatiite unit.
event_text: the randall hills tenements are located in the eastern goldfields province of the yilgarn craton. the eastern goldfields province comprises a series of attenuated archaean greenstone belts intruded by, and interstitial to, similarly elongate granitoid plutons and gneisses. the regional stratigraphy of the randall hills project comprises a sequence of felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks, with minor banded iron formation occurring within the upper portion of the volcaniclastic sequence (jones and hall, 2004), overlying an upper komatiitic basalt unit and a lower basaltic unit, that are separated by an intervening komatiite unit. the komatiite unit is interpreted as a regional marker that extends across the eastern goldfields.

sentence_text: Belches Formation is a thick sequence of deep water submarine fan, flysh facies and turbidites, comprised of graded feldspathic sandstone and laminated siltstone and minor BIF.
event_text: the tenements are located predominantly within the archaean gindalbie terrane. the gindalbie terrane is bounded on its eastern margin by the shallow west dipping, deep crustal randall shear and mount belches formation (figure 4). belches formation is a thick sequence of deep water submarine fan, flysh facies and turbidites, comprised of graded feldspathic sandstone and laminated siltstone and minor bif. belches formation contains the randalls gold camp, a series of deposits that occur within folded quartz magnetite amphibole bif units.

event_text: the prominent ridges are cut by numerous northeast trending faults (see also figure 3).this narrow zone between the large andover intrusive complex to the south and a major regional trust to the north (the recently recognized regal trust) is characterized by intense shearing and brecciation. this tectonised zone of greenstones hosts several deposits of gold copper, nickel (at ruth well) and also base metals. principal gold (+copper) occurrences are found at weerianna, carlow, no.6 well, sing well and nickol river gold mining centre. the total strike length of the outcropping prase is approximately 500 metres and has a width of some 50 metres.

sentence_text: The largely felsic Nickol River Formation contains grey and white-banded chert, ferruginous chert, BIF (Banded Iron Formation), clastic and carbonate sedimentary rocks, quartzite, felsic volcanics, conglomerate and serpentinized peridotite with local spinifex texture.
event_text: the succession comprises a basal volcanic unit, the ruth well formation, which gradually grades into a dominantly sedimentary unit, the nickol river formation. main lithologies of the ruth well formation include basalts, serpentinized peridotitic komatiite with local spinifex texture and thin bands of grey and white banded cherts and black chert. the largely felsic nickol river formation contains grey and white banded chert, ferruginous chert, bif (banded iron formation), clastic and carbonate sedimentary rocks, quartzite, felsic volcanics, conglomerate and serpentinized peridotite with local spinifex texture. the boundary between the ruth well and nickol river formation lies between the basalts at carlow and the main chert horizon hosting the prase.

sentence_text: The Fortnum Wedge is a regionally significant source of gold mineralisation and hosts amongst others the Starlight Group, Yarlarweelor and Toms deposits.
event_text: e52 1659 surrounds the fortnum wedge area to the north, east and south. the fortnum wedge consists of a series of deformed volcanic, volcaniclastic and sedimentary rocks of the narracoota formation which form a deformed and relatively uplifted sequence within ravelstone formation rocks of the lower bryah basin. the fortnum wedge is a regionally significant source of gold mineralisation and hosts amongst others the starlight group, yarlarweelor and toms deposits. e52 1659 is located on the western limb of a folded sequence dominated by ravelstone formation rocks of the lower bryah basin and includes horseshoe formation banded iron in the north east the core of the fold and the south west.

sentence_text: Mineralisation within the Bryah Basin mainly comprises orogenic lode-gold and volcanogenic massive sulphide Cu-Au deposits.
event_text: the d3 d4 event involved ese wnw to e w compression, resulting in n s trending folds and thrust belts. metamorphic grade throughout the bryah basin comprises prograde assemblages up to greenschist facies, post dated by retrograde overprints within high strain zones. mineralisation within the bryah basin mainly comprises orogenic lode gold and volcanogenic massive sulphide cu au deposits. to date, the majority of exploited gold mineralisation is structurally controlled, mesothermal, epigenetic lode systems, formed during the d3 d4 stages of regional deformation.

sentence_text: To date, the majority of exploited gold mineralisation is structurally controlled, mesothermal, epigenetic lode systems, formed during the D3-D4 stages of regional deformation.
event_text: metamorphic grade throughout the bryah basin comprises prograde assemblages up to greenschist facies, post dated by retrograde overprints within high strain zones. mineralisation within the bryah basin mainly comprises orogenic lode gold and volcanogenic massive sulphide cu au deposits. to date, the majority of exploited gold mineralisation is structurally controlled, mesothermal, epigenetic lode systems, formed during the d3 d4 stages of regional deformation. these deposits are spatially associated with high strain zones in metasedimentary and or metavolcanic rocks, and are characterised by narrow zones of hydrothermal alteration.

sentence_text: The Loves Find Prospect, situated about 2.5 kilometres southwest of the Nanutarra Roadhouse, is accessible to the west of the highway via unsealed tracks approximately 1 kilometre south of the roadhouse.
event_text: 2.0 location and access the mt alexander project is situated approximately 20 kilometres south of the nanutarra roadhouse, which is on the north west coastal highway and 275 kilometres south of karratha. the principal access to the project area is provided by the north west coastal highway, to the southwest of the nanutarra roadhouse and station tracks, which usually needed to be upgraded following the summer cyclone season. the loves find prospect, situated about 2.5 kilometres southwest of the nanutarra roadhouse, is accessible to the west of the highway via unsealed tracks approximately 1 kilometre south of the roadhouse. access to the moodang well and mt alexander prospects is gained via the uaroo glenflorrie road, which leaves the highway approximately 20 kilometres southwest of the roadhouse and then by unsealed station tracks.

sentence_text: The Kilba Granite has intruded the Morrissey Metamorphic Suite, producing extensive contact metamorphism and the local development of skarn and marble.
event_text: the sequence was subjected to regional metamorphism, giving rise to the morrissey metamorphic suite. metamorphic grades increase towards the west and southwest, ranging from quartz muscovite schist through to amphibolites, marble and localised migmatite. the kilba granite has intruded the morrissey metamorphic suite, producing extensive contact metamorphism and the local development of skarn and marble. two main phases of deformation are recognised in the wyloo group: d1 deformation resulted in steep dipping bedding and a well developed schistosity coincident with the peak of regional metamorphism.

sentence_text: Mineralisation, with affinities to Broken Hill Pb-Zn style, occurs sporadically over a six kilometre strike length of the sequence.
event_text: local zones of contact metamorphism also indicate the presence of granitoid at shallow depth. the mount alexander prospect, situated at the northern end of tenement e08 1410, encloses a folded sequence of dolomites and banded iron formations (bifs) as part of the ashburton formation within the gascoyne province geological terrane. mineralisation, with affinities to broken hill pb zn style, occurs sporadically over a six kilometre strike length of the sequence. major known mineralisation occurs at cyprus gossan, where drill intercepts of 8 m of 2.83% zn and 0.95% pb and 4m of 3.15% zn have been recorded beneath the main siliceous gossan that has returned 42m of 1.36% zn, 1.08% pb and 17.2 g t ag from surface sampling.

sentence_text: Layered mafic and ultramafic igneous rocks, comprising layered gabbro, pyroxenite, peridotite and dunite, occur along strike in the west of the tenement block.
event_text: these palaeoproterozoic rocks underlie the northern two thirds of the tenement area. the bryah group is represented within the tenement areas by the narracoota formation which comprises metamorphosed basalt, mafic and ultramafic schist, gabbro and dolerite. layered mafic and ultramafic igneous rocks, comprising layered gabbro, pyroxenite, peridotite and dunite, occur along strike in the west of the tenement block. outcrops of the narracoota formation within the tenement areas are almost invariably highly silicified and or ferruginised.

sentence_text: These veins are generally localised along major strike-parallel faults.
event_text: a proterozoic, locally porphyritic, biotite granite intrudes the millidie creek formation within the southeast of the tenement block. narrow quartz veins occur locally within all lithologies exposed in the tenement areas. these veins are generally localised along major strike parallel faults. quaternary deposits obscure bedrock over much of the tenement areas.

sentence_text: Pervasive deformation of the Bryah-Padbury Basins most likely occurred during the Capricorn Orogeny resulting in extensive folding and faulting, with at least Page 4 four stages of deformation noted.
event_text: the southern margin of the trillbar belt is defined by a deformed archaean proterozoic unconformity with the northern margin of the archaean yilgarn craton. the northern margin of the trillbar belt overlies and is in fault contact with the late archaean yarlarweelor gneiss complex of the narryer terrane. pervasive deformation of the bryah padbury basins most likely occurred during the capricorn orogeny resulting in extensive folding and faulting, with at least page 4 four stages of deformation noted. in some locations, the rock units on the southern margin of the trillbar belt have been described as exhibiting mylonitic fabrics.

sentence_text: Structure within the tenement block is dominated by a series of west to west-northwest trending strike-parallel faults (the Trillbar Gold Corridor), which have been inferred from aeromagnetic data, and display a spatial association with gold mineralisation.
event_text: metamorphism varies throughout the bryah padbury basin, although rarely exceeding greenschist facies, with the trillbar belt predominantly in the mid upper greenschist facies. one of the major faults occurring within the bryah padbury basin is the wnw ese trending coolinbar fortnum fault, which appears to be spatially related to the majority of the gold deposits within the fortnum and labouchere mining camps. structure within the tenement block is dominated by a series of west to west northwest trending strike parallel faults (the trillbar gold corridor), which have been inferred from aeromagnetic data, and display a spatial association with gold mineralisation. these faults include the fault at the contact between the narracoota formation and the millidie creek formation.

sentence_text: Exploration Licence 52/1675, comprising part of the Trillbar Project, has been shown by previous historic mining to contain significant gold mineralisation, with past work also confirming this potential.

sentence_text: The Wiluna domain is a low grade, prehnite-pumpellyite facies, metamorphic terrain comprising mafic to ultramafic lavas with intercalated sedimentary units, felsic volcanics and dolerite sills overlain by a thick pile of felsic volcanics, tuffaceous sediments, and sedimentary rocks, interrupted by extrusion of a large volume of komatiitic lava.
event_text: the wiluna greenstone belt can be divided into two metamorphic domains, the wiluna domain in the east and the matilda domain in the west. the major north west trending perseverance fault (also known as the erawalla fault) separates the domains. the wiluna domain is a low grade, prehnite pumpellyite facies, metamorphic terrain comprising mafic to ultramafic lavas with intercalated sedimentary units, felsic volcanics and dolerite sills overlain by a thick pile of felsic volcanics, tuffaceous sediments, and sedimentary rocks, interrupted by extrusion of a large volume of komatiitic lava. primary igneous textures and structures are well preserved, and deformation is predominantly brittle.

sentence_text: The Matilda domain is a medium to high grade, greenschist to lower amphibolite facies, metamorphic terrain with predominantly ductile deformation.
event_text: the wiluna domain is a low grade, prehnite pumpellyite facies, metamorphic terrain comprising mafic to ultramafic lavas with intercalated sedimentary units, felsic volcanics and dolerite sills overlain by a thick pile of felsic volcanics, tuffaceous sediments, and sedimentary rocks, interrupted by extrusion of a large volume of komatiitic lava. primary igneous textures and structures are well preserved, and deformation is predominantly brittle. the matilda domain is a medium to high grade, greenschist to lower amphibolite facies, metamorphic terrain with predominantly ductile deformation. it consists of a volcano sedimentary sequence in an interpreted major north west trending synclinal structure, with the axis close to the perseverance fault.

sentence_text: Gold mineralisation, hosted by all major lithologic units, is controlled by the Wiluna Fault System (WFS), which consists of north- and northeast-trending, steeply east- and west-dipping sets of dextral strike-slip faults that disrupt the stratigraphy.

sentence_text: Mineralisation is localised along faults at dilational bends or jogs, fault intersection, horsetail splays and in subsidiary overstepping faults.

sentence_text: GEOLOGY The Gascoyne project area contains a sequence of Ordovician to Permian sediments that overlie Precambrian basement rocks.
event_text: the project area is located approximately 100 km east north east of the overlander roadhouse in the gascoyne mineral field. access is via station and oilrig access tracks leading off from the main gravel road from the overlander roadhouse to byro station. geology the gascoyne project area contains a sequence of ordovician to permian sediments that overlie precambrian basement rocks. the main target is the yaringa member of the 750mthick, dirk hartog formation of silurian age.

sentence_text: A recent detailed analysis of drilling, seismic, gravity and other geological data has resulted in the identification of several areas that are prospective for potash mineralisation.
event_text: bromine levels in the halite are high (up to 330ppm), suggesting precipitation from highly concentrated halite and bittern field brines. traces of sylvite (kcl) were reported in the yaringa no 1 well. a recent detailed analysis of drilling, seismic, gravity and other geological data has resulted in the identification of several areas that are prospective for potash mineralisation. the selection criteria for the targets include local thickening of the target dirk hartog formation (figure 2) at basin edges and locations in the distal parts of the basin where high order evaporite brines were generated and salts precipitated.

sentence_text: Because of the poor exposure of basement rocks, the region has attracted very little exploration effort in the past, but has subcrop and geophysical signatures suggesting the occurrence of mafic-ultramafic intrusions with potential for base metal sulphide and platinum group metal (PGM) mineralisation.
event_text: the tenement is 45km wsw of halls creek (district population, 3,300) which lies on the sealed great northern highway between broome (690km to the west) and kununurra (370km to the north). most of the tenement area lies over the laterite and alluvium covered nicholson plain along the margaret river. because of the poor exposure of basement rocks, the region has attracted very little exploration effort in the past, but has subcrop and geophysical signatures suggesting the occurrence of mafic ultramafic intrusions with potential for base metal sulphide and platinum group metal (pgm) mineralisation. exploration activities for the 2009 reporting period were focused on determining if high grade cu zn feeder zones exist at depth; define strike extent; and improve the understanding of controls on mineralisation to assist in geological modelling with the ultimate aim of outlining a resource.
