sentence_text: The aim of the AEM survey was to identify conductors associated with base metal mineralisation.
event_text: exploration activities for the second year of the project reporting period were dominated by the pursuit of base metal targets in the largely covered terrain. to this goal, an airborne electromagnetic (aem) survey (hoistem) over targets generated from the processing and evaluation of the detailed low level magnetic data acquired by the company last year was completed. the aim of the aem survey was to identify conductors associated with base metal mineralisation. the survey comprised three areas covering portions of the tenement; red billabong 3 246 line kms and red billabong 4 234 line kms.

sentence_text: The genesis of mineralisation at Emull is not certain, although models based on an origin as a volcanic hosted massive sulphide (VHMS) deposit partially assimilated during intrusion of gabbro, or as a skarn developed during intrusion of gabbro into carbonate units within the Koongie Park Formation, have been proposed.

sentence_text: Trend Exploration in the course of investigating a radiometric anomaly, discovered what has now become the Brockman specialty metal deposit, 16 km south-east of Halls Creek, containing economically significant niobium, tantalum, zirconium, yitrium and other REE.
event_text: it is generally considered that most of the historical gold production of the area was never recorded (official production to 1964 totalled 1056.8 kg), but none the less, rich auriferous alluvials and quartz reefs were rapidly worked out and miners turned progressively south to discover goldfields in the pilbara, murchison, southern cross, coolgardie and kalgoorlie districts. little mineral exploration or development took place in the kimberley until the 1950s when the bureau of mineral resources carried out an airborne radiometric survey over part of the region and prompted considerable activity by companies searching for uranium deposits. trend exploration in the course of investigating a radiometric anomaly, discovered what has now become the brockman specialty metal deposit, 16 km south east of halls creek, containing economically significant niobium, tantalum, zirconium, yitrium and other ree. gold exploration over the past 20 years has defined potentially economic quartz stockwork mineralisation around old workings at mt bradley, palm springs and nicholsons find.

event_text: a bulletin on the geology of the east kimberley and its mineral occurrences was compiled by dow and gemuts (1969) and gemuts (1971) described the metamorphic and igneous rocks of the lamboo complex, the main mineralized geological unit of the east kimberley. during the period 1990 1995, part of the area was re mapped at 1:100,000 and 1:250,000 scale by the gswa and agso as part of the national geoscience mapping accord, kimberley arunta project. this work, which included whole rock geochemical, petrological, geochronological, and remote sensing studies resulted in a fundamental re appraisal of the geological evolution of the region and vastly improved understanding of the geological setting and mode of occurrence of known and potential economic mineralisation. most of the tenement area lies over the alluvium covered nicholson plain between the seasonally flowing margaret and laura river systems.

sentence_text: The Koongie Park Formation outcrops on parts of the tenement and is host to NSTs Emull prospect mineralisation.
event_text: the oldest rocks in the central zone belong to the koongie park formation which on the basis of recent zircon dating now includes rocks formerly mapped as tickalara metamorphics. the formation is composed of metamorphosed mafic volcanic rocks, felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks with turbiditic sandstone, laminated siltstone and mudstone, and thin chert layers interbedded with carbonate and iron formation layers. the koongie park formation outcrops on parts of the tenement and is host to nsts emull prospect mineralisation. (it should be noted that the angelo 1:100,000 map sheet still uses the old tickalara terminology).

sentence_text: The intrusion has been the target of extensive exploration for Cr, PGE, Au, Ni and Cu mineralisation and is well summarized in Saunders (1999).
event_text: it should be noted that the angelo 1:100,000 map sheet still uses the old tickalara terminology). the lamboo ultramafics form a nne trending elliptical intrusion about 6km long and 2 3km wide and a smaller intrusion (~1km2) some 3 km to the north in the extreme south east area of e80 2612. the intrusion has been the target of extensive exploration for cr, pge, au, ni and cu mineralisation and is well summarized in saunders (1999). the sally downs supersuite consisting of extensive granitoid, massive gabbro and mingled gabbro granitoid is believed to underlie much the area southeast of margaret river.

sentence_text: The Sally Downs supersuite consisting of extensive granitoid, massive gabbro and mingled gabbro-granitoid is believed to underlie much the area southeast of Margaret River.
event_text: the lamboo ultramafics form a nne trending elliptical intrusion about 6km long and 2 3km wide and a smaller intrusion (~1km2) some 3 km to the north in the extreme south east area of e80 2612. the intrusion has been the target of extensive exploration for cr, pge, au, ni and cu mineralisation and is well summarized in saunders (1999). the sally downs supersuite consisting of extensive granitoid, massive gabbro and mingled gabbro granitoid is believed to underlie much the area southeast of margaret river. contacts between granitoid and gabbro are frequently complex and indicative of coeval mafic and felsic magmatism.

sentence_text: The Emull Gabbro is a NNE elongate intrusion approximately 15 km long by 7-8km wide occurring over a large potion of the tenement and its intrusion is probably associated with genesis of the Emull prospect base metal mineralisation.
event_text: the sally downs supersuite consisting of extensive granitoid, massive gabbro and mingled gabbro granitoid is believed to underlie much the area southeast of margaret river. contacts between granitoid and gabbro are frequently complex and indicative of coeval mafic and felsic magmatism. the emull gabbro is a nne elongate intrusion approximately 15 km long by 7 8km wide occurring over a large potion of the tenement and its intrusion is probably associated with genesis of the emull prospect base metal mineralisation. other areas of outcropping gabbro include the informally named eaglehawk crossing gabbro in the extreme south of the tenement area where approximately 10km2 of outcrop are exposed and a further 4km2 probably subcrops beneath black soil and alluvium.

sentence_text: The Mesoproterozoic Yampi Orogeny is most strongly evident in the tenement area as a series of large scale, NNE trending series of sinistral strike-slip faults, initially developed in Palaeoproterozoic times along the Lamboo Complex zone boundaries and becoming more brittle in later re-activations.
event_text: the halls creek orogeny commenced around 1835 ma in the eastern zone of the lamboo complex, but in the central zone and western zones of the lamboo complex in the red billabong region only later phases are recorded as deformation and metamorphic overprints on the older rocks including intrusions of the sally downs supersuite. although sediments and mafic volcanics of the palaeoproterozoic kimberley group are preserved both east and west of the tenement, they have probably been completely stripped by erosion within the tenement. the mesoproterozoic yampi orogeny is most strongly evident in the tenement area as a series of large scale, nne trending series of sinistral strike slip faults, initially developed in palaeoproterozoic times along the lamboo complex zone boundaries and becoming more brittle in later re activations. three phases of folding are evident in the kimberley group sediments and volcanics east of the tenement, but little evidence of the orogeny is visible other than alignment of the margaret and laura rivers and some of their larger tributaries along the major faults.

sentence_text: Larger areas still retain a veneer of quartz sand and soil and shallow valleys contain thin colluvial deposits of reworked laterite gravel and sand.
event_text: cainozoic laterite occurs extensively throughout the tenement area, forming a plateau dissected by the margaret river and its tributaries. erosion has reduced much of the laterite blanket into irregular remnants with low angle escarpments and stony surfaces. larger areas still retain a veneer of quartz sand and soil and shallow valleys contain thin colluvial deposits of reworked laterite gravel and sand. shallow alluvial sand and gravel occupies the valley of the margaret river which closely follows the underlying trace of the billabong and margaret river faults.

sentence_text: In addition, the routine geochemical detection of platinoids (and gold) at very low detection levels only became practical in the mid-1990s and associated gold mineralisation is usually very fine grained and not detectable by traditional prospecting.
event_text: models for specific deposits or groups of deposits discussed in the literature include; basal sulphide segregation ni cu copgm model feeder zone or magma conduit deposits deposits in mafic sills associated with flood basalts structurally controlled hydrothermally remobilised polymetallic deposits such as lac des iles in ontario (cu au ni pgm), are not as well understood, but are probably derived by hydrothermal leaching of metals from large masses of brecciated mafic ultramafic rock and deposition in breccias or structural dilation zones by mechanisms similar to the welldocumented archaean gold deposits of wa. they have not been a focus of past prospecting in the east kimberley as the extent and variety of such deposits are only becoming apparent in recent years. in addition, the routine geochemical detection of platinoids (and gold) at very low detection levels only became practical in the mid 1990s and associated gold mineralisation is usually very fine grained and not detectable by traditional prospecting. for these reasons, such deposits are unlikely to have been identified in the past and remain a focus of exploration at red billabong.

sentence_text: Contractor data files and profile plots are contained in Appendix 1.
event_text: the early to mid time responses in this area are reidy swamp project 2006 17 elevated but the response is probably due to saline groundwater the transient follows a t 3 power law decay, which is usually associated with thick, conductive overburden. anomaly ke04 lies within a similar part of the stratigraphy to ke02, and is likely to be sourced from a sedimentary unit. contractor data files and profile plots are contained in appendix 1. the reidy swamp tenements lie within the boorara domain of the kalgoorlie terrane.

sentence_text: The two major central domains (Kambalda and Ora Banda) contain the complete regional stratigraphic sequence, whereas the western and eastern domains (Coolgardie and Boorara) have an upper basalt unit that is thin or absent.
event_text: the kalgoorlie terrane is subdivided into six domains separated by major faults. regional structures such as d1 thrust faults, f2 folds and d3 shears cannot be traced across the domain boundary faults. the two major central domains (kambalda and ora banda) contain the complete regional stratigraphic sequence, whereas the western and eastern domains (coolgardie and boorara) have an upper basalt unit that is thin or absent. the boorara domain, bounded by the bardoc shear zone to the west and the mount monger fault to the east, is interpreted as the easternmost part of the kalgoorlie terrane.

sentence_text: In the Boorara domain, more complex lithostratigraphic successions are recorded because early felsic volcanism in distinct centres developed at the same time as the regional extensive komatiite volcanic flows.
event_text: the boorara domain, bounded by the bardoc shear zone to the west and the mount monger fault to the east, is interpreted as the easternmost part of the kalgoorlie terrane. this terrane is regarded as an originally coherent volcano sedimentary basin formed between 2.72 ga and 2.68 ga, and is characterized by a regional lithostratigraphy of four units, ie, lower tholeiitic basalt, komatiite, upper high mg basalt and a composite felsic unit dominated by subaqueous dacitic rhyolitic lavas and their clastic derivatives. in the boorara domain, more complex lithostratigraphic successions are recorded because early felsic volcanism in distinct centres developed at the same time as the regional extensive komatiite volcanic flows. these units generally trend north east, and prominent structural lineations in the form of shear zones trend northwesterly.

sentence_text: The terrane contains three greenstone successions separated by regional lowangle faults.
event_text: these units generally trend north east, and prominent structural lineations in the form of shear zones trend northwesterly. the gindalbie terrane lies to the east of the kalgoorlie terrane, and is bounded by the mount monger fault in the west, the emu fault in the east and the randall fault in the southeast. the terrane contains three greenstone successions separated by regional lowangle faults. these early (d1) faults are folded and offset by subsequent (d2 and d3) folds and faults.

sentence_text: The lowermost calc-alkaline succession contains a range of rocks from andesitic basalt to rhyolite, with predominant dacite and andesite.
event_text: the terrane contains three greenstone successions separated by regional lowangle faults. these early (d1) faults are folded and offset by subsequent (d2 and d3) folds and faults. the lowermost calc alkaline succession contains a range of rocks from andesitic basalt to rhyolite, with predominant dacite and andesite. lava flows may be present but are subordinate to pyroclastic rocks.

sentence_text: REIDY SWAMP PROJECT 2006 11 The lowermost succession is overlain by mafic-ultramafic rocks dominated by komatiite that contains thin inter-layered felsic tuff layers.
event_text: they include carbonaceous, locally pyritic, slate close to and along the interpreted fault contact with the overlying mafic ultramafic association. a faultbounded, isoclinally folded tholeiitic basaltgabbro package restricted to the western limb of the anticline is regarded as a separate thrust slice with early recumbent folding. reidy swamp project 2006 11 the lowermost succession is overlain by mafic ultramafic rocks dominated by komatiite that contains thin inter layered felsic tuff layers. on the eastern limb of the bulong anticline, the komatiite is interleaved with increasing volumes of tholeiitic basalt.

sentence_text: The uppermost association forms the northern part of the terrane, and contains a bimodal basalt-felsic volcanic (dacite-rhyolite) sequence.
event_text: the komatiite tholeiite association is older than the felsic association it overlies. the massive olivine cumulate in the west is transitional to and interleaved with olivine spinifex and komatiitic basalt layers that generally increase in volume upwards in the sequence. the uppermost association forms the northern part of the terrane, and contains a bimodal basalt felsic volcanic (dacite rhyolite) sequence. the gindalbie terrane thus contains three distinct greenstone successions bounded by early, low angle faults.

sentence_text: The Gindalbie Terrane thus contains three distinct greenstone successions bounded by early, low angle faults.

sentence_text: On the western side of the shear zone the Jubilee Terrane, the bedrock sequence comprises minor basalts, komatiites, sedimentary rock and minor felsic volcanics.
event_text: flanking the belt are major archaean intrusive granitic bodies. the major structural feature of the property area is the north northwest trending avoca shear zone that dips to the west. on the western side of the shear zone the jubilee terrane, the bedrock sequence comprises minor basalts, komatiites, sedimentary rock and minor felsic volcanics. to the east the kurnalpi terrane, the sequence is dominated by basalt, dolerite and sediments and in the easternmost portions of the kurnalpi property by felsic volcanic rocks.

sentence_text: Bedrock gold mineralisation is associated with the major Avoca Shear Zone and with the northeast trending faults.
event_text: late stage northeast trending faults cross cut the avoca shear zone and east to east southeast trending thrust faults are interpreted as being present in the north to the south of an intrusive granite. tertiary and quaternary deposits of various origins cover the bedrock sequence and dominate much of the area where outcrops are generally sparse. bedrock gold mineralisation is associated with the major avoca shear zone and with the northeast trending faults. gold derived from the bedrock structures has entered the alluvial sequences and was a major source of the gold produced during the active mining period at kurnalpi.

sentence_text: Nickel mineralisation is present mainly in the west of the Kurnalpi property where it is present both in the laterite weathering profile overlying ultramafic sequences and also in the bedrock.
event_text: gold derived from the bedrock structures has entered the alluvial sequences and was a major source of the gold produced during the active mining period at kurnalpi. the gold was noted as being coarse grained and nuggety in distribution. nickel mineralisation is present mainly in the west of the kurnalpi property where it is present both in the laterite weathering profile overlying ultramafic sequences and also in the bedrock. a plan of the local geology (gswa mapping) of the project area is shown in figure 1.

sentence_text: North-south drainage channels were identified leading into the Lake Yindarlgooda system with extensions leading out of the system and displaying a geological sequence containing serpentinised peridotic rocks and some indication of alkaline intrusives and kimberlitic magnetic expression.
event_text: previous exploration by striker resources nl on exploration licence 28 463 [now dead; overlapping the southern portion of p28 1025 and p28 1026 and all of p28 1029 and p28 1030] returned three microdiamonds with prospectivity further enhanced when the presence of chrome spinels and pyrope garnet were identified as well as kimberlite indicators. artrayu investments then commenced a field search for host lithologies for diamonds. north south drainage channels were identified leading into the lake yindarlgooda system with extensions leading out of the system and displaying a geological sequence containing serpentinised peridotic rocks and some indication of alkaline intrusives and kimberlitic magnetic expression. results were disappointing from their field studies and the tenement was considered to be not economically viable and was surrendered.

sentence_text: No significant gold was found.
event_text: the work conducted by gutnick resources nv consisted firstly of an aeromagnetic survey followed by geomodelling of positive magnetic anomalies to plan rc drilling. it was determined that the anomalies were more or less continuous and thought to have been derived from one or more dyke like bodies usually dipping steeply to the west. no significant gold was found. 5.0 conclusions and recommendations future exploration of the tenement area should include further geochemical sampling to identify possible targets after which an aircore programme could should be designed.
